8UzI27dhDniiAD8_2aSzRA.text: I've had Christina a couple times at The Porch for a server. She has great customer service and good advice on menu choices. I always ask for her when I go here!

PKZ7-r7bX6IE-ewkZAQ_Lg.text: We had drinks and dinner at the porch. I had the south of the border Marguerite out which was fabulous and the fried pickles were excellent as well.   Logan was our server and he was a wonderful waiter!  Then we had the coffee and Passport coffee is the best!

_1zrmDE9zFni31HTqQggew.text: Logan was awesome, food was great and music was the best. Would totally comeback great atmosphere.

-N1gRElIx-L4WXQAVgjvQA.text: First time at the Porch! Great food, great beer and great service. Ask for Bruce he's a rockstar! Beer was never empty food was always warm. #bruce2020

NUuvWp8eD70_VV8L-BDHMQ.text: Love the food, drinks, and atmosphere at this place. I tried this place out the second week they were open and was not disappointed. Must try if you are in Arcadia.

oAn6w-fh7i1Vl3-GA-jeow.text: Looking for a night filled with good music, cornhole (not bean bag toss for all your haters), delicious protein bowls, and birthday's for forty year old frat guys?! Then the Porch is the right place for you. I went on my first date in five years yesterday and it was definitely worth the wait. As we got seated, MY DATE GOT TO LITERALLY SIT ON A SWING. That's win number one for me. After we were seated, our waitress was attentive, nice, and helpful. I ordered the Porch protein bowl and I could feel the GAINS coming every time I took a bite. My date got the seizure salad and loved it. That's win number two. After finishing dinner, we proceeded to play cornhole. I took this as an opportunity to try and teach my date the way of the corn. But little did I know she was a natural. Girl straight cornholed three in a row at one point, definitely destroying the confidence in my game. That was the only L I took all night. Overall, the Porch provided me with a first date experience I will never forget! Moral of the story: never underestimate how good people from Indiana are at cornhole. You will instantly regret it. #GCUGAINTRAIN

FSaHtfpmM6eJidwufvTn7Q.text: The tacos were delicious and the service was awesome. We had Jessica and she was so sweet and professional.

iKygDAhV8DF_qeiYpb5fpw.text: Read a bunch of the bad reviews but personally had a really good experience. Reuben was outstanding. Sweet potato waffle fries were top notch. Daughter really enjoyed her chicken sandwich with truffle fries. Good beer selection. Service was prompt and pleasant. Great layout and decor. One beer order error was promptly corrected. Only minor complaint was awful plastic beer glasses. Would never order a draft beer here or if I do I'd ask for a glass glass.

jSstu_cfcibLidOy5Qj7jA.text: Burger was good Karma friendly staff, good atmosphere, and a nice mix of all kinds of music

VO99NdiJh-Hh_qI3QcYdXw.text: I too REALLy  wanted this place to be amazing. We came during the week of soft opening (sat at the bar) and ordered the  wings. They were really good - service was pretty good.   Came back a couple of weeks later and my expectations were up a bit as I was anxious to order off the menu. Tons of servers standing around and food was "meh" nothing other than regular bar food. I thought the servers by now would be rock stars and no one seemed to be too interested in the few customers that were in there.  We live in the neighborhood and we're glad to see bike racks went up.  Well give it another try as we really want this place to work but there's a lot of competition opening nearby - needs to be exceptional.

Gf-SK8VqOLzvVDi9Qniuaw.text: The food, ambiance and service was impeccable. The manager Eric came by and made sure our entire party was happy. The outdoor patio made it so we never wanted to leave. This place will be a big hit!

0BAYaQWxGbznSgy_L1uxow.text: I've never seen a place improve week after week. Hats off to the owners and management!

SG30zRTG8PXIccFnEt1Bxw.text: Typical Arcadia trendy place. Good happy hour. Service at the bar was poor. Had to ask the bar back for a drink.

zjLZcY9sTIEHf-MyPVoCRg.text: Jessica(pretty sure that was the bartenders name)...she ruled. They dont take reservations but i like to live on the edge also so i dont blame them. Walking distance from my house but more importantly walking distance TO my house. 5/5.

QHLaQqhJbt98ViVSBz-fjA.text: I was visiting with my boyfriend and we drove by the porch. It looked nice from the outside so we decided to give it a shot. I ordered the salted pretzel and the Mediterranean chicken pita. Pretzel was good but they really hit it out of the park with the chicken pita. Service was great and our server was super friendly.

A0UDxZQBRkWvuL7xtToP5A.text: I went here yesterday and had The Porch Burger, one of the best burgers I've had in a while! This place has a great atmosphere, my friends and I didn't even notice two hour had passed while we were playing Jenga on the patio. I will definitely be coming back here next time I am in town!

JgYOcR8TgfHykhIrET7hGg.text: This was my first visit to The Porch. We had ten in our party and was able to make advanced reservations, which was a good thing because the place was packed. We were seated promptly and our server, Bruce, was efficient, friendly, and competent. Eric, the manager, spent time reviewing the menu with us in detail. I dine mostly at bar and grills and expected the standard fare. And although the menu offers lots of salads and sandwiches, it was definitely not the standard fare - I had a very tasty Mediterranean Pita with a much better than average side salad. I found the prices for food and drink average for similar establishments. The wine selection is well rounded. The patrons seemed to be having a lot of fun. The ASU basketball game got a lot of attention and the dart board and shuffleboard were well used. The only issue I had was the noise level, making it difficult for our group of ten to have audible conversation.

iM2b7DzVKfqRUWFmTxZpig.text: My fiance and I had driven past before and decided we would try it the next time we were on that side of town. 3 weeks ago we went on a Saturday night- we were seated right away and put in orders for drinks- the drinks came and the beer was warm- asked for a cold glass and took at least 15 minutes to get one. Food was ok- I had a rice bowl and it was decent, he had a burger that he said he's had better. He paid via credit card and we left. Two days later, his credit card company contacted him saying The Porch was trying to submit a charge for $10 more than the bill. Mind you, we're very generous tippers and left a decent tip with the bill, but they tried for more. He called and spoke to a gentleman who stated he would see a credit within 48 hours. 5 days later, still no credit so he called again, another guy answered the phone, took down his name and CC# and stated he submitted the credit right then- 2 days later, nothing. He ended up having to submit a dispute to the credit card company and got the credit immediately. Will never go back and will NOT recommend this place!!

CnzKCUleaBGLVOHkLrGBEQ.text: The staff was very helpful and our food came out quickly. The ambience and patio are so cute!

0gFuy8pt2YRt1a5dvUaQ2w.text: Great atmosphere, great location and excellent food.  Architecture is interesting but definitely nice.  Fun games, comfortable seating and friendly for both adults and families.  Logan our server was AWESOME!! Thank you for a fun experience!  Definitely will be back.

N4ej-9sZLEBXJlq3cjzPVg.text: Bad reviews??? Just go and enjoy yourself, leave your critiques at home. This place has a sweet set-up. Ive never had a problem with service. Beer selection good and the appetizers I've had were great. Cool neighborhood addition.   P.s. still miss the hot n sour soup at little shanghai r.i.p.

8kN4f9qq0oRE7okSAL7hbw.text: Just keep driving and go to OHSO.   As a proud dog mom, I am always looking for great places to take my little fur child to eat some dinner. Not only was the staff rude when I called to make sure their patio was dog-friendly (this should've been a clue), our original server was so terrible that after we moved tables our new server was ALSO saying how bad she was! WHAT?!   The food was horribly overpriced and wasn't good. Service was terrible.   Husband was irritated, dog was irritated, and we paid $75 to end up still hungry.

FmzrnO0ri1__am8f1ojd9A.text: I'm into The Porch. Food is straightforward and good, service is always on-point, everything is affordable (when they really could charge more because of the area), and the location is perfect.  Aesthetically, the place is cool and has a great mix of bar seating, booths, tables, outdoor seating, etc.  Great spot, worth a visit if you are from out of town and worth dropping in every now and then if you are local.

ATFxqwwD2yed6iI-Bd0iwQ.text: This place is great. The prices are a bit steep for a lunch, but the food is definitely worth the price. It is also great that the place is dog friendly.  Make sure you get the sweet potato fries, they are the best. The service was good, but definitely stumbles a bit once you get past 6 or so people.   The only thing is I wish they could not have valet parking, at least during week day lunch times.  It adds an extra step you have to time around for a work lunch.  If I could give a 4.5 I would, but don't want to take off a whole star for such a minor thing.

aiQ6isDbf7ziT-uiz2XOhg.text: Love this place! I cant remember our servers name but she was so nice. She needed to move us at one point during the night since she had a huge party coming in. Being a sever myself I understood. She was so caring about the situation and really went above and beyond to make sure we were taken care of. Also, Logan is exceptional! Always so friendly and really gives a great feel to the place when he greets you at the door.

dTSfBU43H_QiKxOBqGnsnQ.text: This place is busy... no doubt.. however, they still have kinks to work out with food and drinks.   Been sitting here with three other people, first round of drinks came out in a reasonable amount of time, but second round we were told that the bar is backed up due to last call for happy hour.  Food has taken a long time as well.   Hope things can get worked out, as good food and prompt service will bring you loyal customers for sure.

THM_LGaClrXMHY5XhxQ7WA.text: Visited this place on multiple occasions and really loved the atmosphere! First time we went with family and sat outside on their patio & everyone enjoyed it. I had the truffle fries + short rib nachos and they were delicious. My sister and brother in law really enjoyed their fig mule, while I had the big trouble in little shanghai. I thought it was pretty clever packaging! Jess was a great server! Came back for a second time and this time sat at the bar. Props to Ty and the amazing bar staff for the awesome service and drinks. Really liked the shrimp teriyaki bowl!! I highly recommend giving this place a try! :)

photos.caption: Photo of The Porch - Phoenix, AZ, United States

um8oJswz6S4ZgOAIw55x8w.text: This star isn't for the food or drinks, it's for the crappy customer service by management.   Called today (Monday) to make a reservation for next Saturday (1/13) for a birthday party for 8 people, two of which are kids. They called me back about a half hour later saying they couldn't actually take our reservation because there's a football game that day. Um, what? We just wanted a table to come eat and celebrate and you can't take our reservation because it might be busy? That's why we're asking to reserve a table. We asked for an early reservation at 3pm. The girl I spoke with was very nice and I'm not shooting the messenger. I just find it rude that a new place in the area is turning bigger parties away because they're anticipating a big football crowd.   The good news is there are plenty of other restaurants that we will be happy to celebrate at. The Porch won't miss us, but considering the already less than stellar reviews, maybe they should. My dad (the birthday boy) was looking forward to this place so that's a big bummer  :(

ocB5-THZHT4xyGeJcNmkPA.text: Good happy hour and cute place.  Really liked my hamburger and truffle fries. Loved the atmosphere as well.

wohPJblAPH3zYJEiTpxJhg.text: Food was ok. It looks better in the pictures than it tastes. The wait staff was friendly and attentive and the atmosphere was decent.

yzkXI6m6OWa8_w5m1fwj_g.text: Pretty neat new spot in Arcadia, with nice bar and TV's w/ sports. Check and check twice your order(s) if you get food to go. Ordered Chicken Caesar salad w/ dressing on side....No dressing. Ordered Short Rib teriyaki bowl w/ extra short rib....no extra short rib. How hard is it to get a to-go order correct/ Maddening. May return for bar, but no more than than that.

zuF60ZrH05Jqo3tJzmlrgg.text: The food had mixed reviews the tacos were awesome and the grill cheese sandwich was the bomb. Sadly the wings didn't hold up to the standard there other food set. Drinks were good and ambiance for a Tuesday was okay. We will come again! We were told that weekends the atmosphere changes significantly.

photos.caption: Photo of The Porch - Phoenix, AZ, United States

tQ0Hi3bhxzy47LJMwLG1ow.text: Great atmosphere/ambiance .. the drinks are not that great someone needs to take a bar tending class, loved their jalapeno poppers.. Usually come here just for the ambiance though always a good time and our waitress was extremely friendly!!

9jBlt0CZPt06C4lfxhN1VA.text: Was there on Sunday, December 17th with some girlfriends. I had high expectations, but the food was lacking (both in volume and taste). First... when HALF of your menu is unavailable you should notify your guests upon seating them. It wasn't until after our server brought us drinks that she told us that ALL of the tacos were off the menu and that the preztel bites were out and ALL appetizers that had some form of meat had been switched with what was available. Second... as I had to switch my order last minute (I wanted tacos), I settled on the bruschetta. It was eh. Very bread heavy and was barely room temperature when arrived and cold by the time I finished.   One last thing... It was cold on Sunday (we were there around 7 p.m.) and they had the sliding glass doors open. This made for a VERY uncomfortable dinner... we were ALL freezing.

Fqx1sYh5fBLSmqIz3dWJzA.text: Drinks were alright but service was definitely lacking. Stopped in today with a friend and had drinks sitting at the bar. I had the South of the Border cocktail that was pretty good, although I'm not sure if I'd order it again for $13. But the major thing that factored into my rating is that the bartender seemed annoyed we were even there. My friend and I commented on how she didn't smile once the entire time we were there and hardly said a word, until the very end as we left and she greeted a guy sitting down by himself. Maybe it was just us? Not sure but based on today's visit I definitely don't plan on going back.

eo89MkeqBhckEQACdoSSPA.text: Pros: Great location, fun games, good food. Cons: the staff are severally undertrained and inexperienced. Visited the Porch 5-6 times in the last 8 months and the results are always the same. Slow service, staff on their cell phones half the time, inexperienced bartenders, hostess who have no idea what their job is. At this point you have to blame the mangers and hiring staff for putting people in these positions. Either they're trying to save a buck or the don't have a clue. There no way they can't take note of the terrible service.

SZw4rqCNiioTjhEzHR5sAg.text: I'm all about dog friendly restaurants as I enjoy taking my pupper with me as much as possible. The Porch is a great spot for some drinks and appetizers while enjoying a fun, low key atmosphere. I have been here a few time since they opened and I can't say I have loved any of their entrees. If I were choosing solely on dinner choices, this wouldn't be a first pick. That being said, it's fantastic for the before or after drink stop.

photos.caption: Photo of The Porch - Phoenix, AZ, United States

K15D6vqhEh-nbXR_vfHwOg.text: My boyfriend and I were excited to check this new place out! He arrived before me and had trouble waving down the server. Once I arrived, we noticed that the server section was too much and he could never get caught up. It was hard seeing such a great server drowning while management was just standing there.  When we attempted to order the PBLT, we were informed that they decided not to work with pork belly...? Why have it on the menu...? I thought this was interesting considering they just opened...  I ordered the vegan poke bowl and the portions were incredibly small for the price. When the nachos arrived the steak was cold, but had decent flavoring.  Between the portion size and cold steak I had to give 3 stars. Hopefully before Phoenix's busy season they can figure It all out.

k9njo5vqZeK844Mc9Zgnzw.text: Finally went in to check it out.... living in the neighborhood watched this place go up so I was very happy to be able to sit on the "patio" on a beautiful day finally.  I had the Porch protein and it was so good, Worth the wait! The gal who waited on us was good as well!!  Will most definitely be back!!

GqLPKtFfOew0ky7AcNFJbw.text: This place has been non-stop packed since their soft opening, so they've had very little time to catch their breath. My wife and I run an Ugly Christmas Sweater Bike Bar Crawl in the Arcadia area and the Porch happens to land right in our normal path. Knowing they were still in their soft opening at this time and wouldn't necessarily be prepared to welcome 65 rowdy drinkers with the Christmas spirit (that's what we'll call our drunkenness) I decided to ask the GM if he'd be okay if we came in on short notice. He didn't hesitate and said they'd love to have us.  A few days later, we rolled in to an already jam packed place on their first Saturday afternoon and everything went off without a hitch. We got a warm welcome, great service, and a great atmosphere. Reviews so far don't do this place justice and you'd know what I mean if you got to drive by the Porch every day. It has been busy every day since it opened and it's a great addition to the Arcadia area!

b1oYrN5yjidbaucE9Px2Gg.text: First time here.. kinda tired and hungover but Logan's aggressively positive attitude brought me back to life! Great place, great staff! Logan pours mimosas like a bossssaa

i6jRYuqUJ0v77MYsUwndoQ.text: Logan pours mimosas like a boss. Food is pretty good and the ambience is fun. Brunch is pretty low-key, but if you come for dinner be prepared for crowds.

Pnbw_y9Akz0NWDyF5WBvXA.text: Logan is the man!!! He provided great service and was so attentive to our needs. Thanks for everything! Will come again.

gp5Fh1sP1A1BWUipeoD8CQ.text: Awesome time at the porch. Christina was a great server and took care of us the entire time. She was wonderful, timely, funny, and outgoing. Pretzels were bomb.

o7-PCv4r8FrPiqSitoHomQ.text: Nice atmosphere & great DJ.  Yes,  I agree, why all the negative reviews? This place is great  for the neighborhood. Just chill and have a great  time.

gM4HRyl0Bpo956hleUYcEA.text: Very excited to have a new fun spot in Arcadia to grab a cocktail and a bite. My husband and I stopped in this past Sunday (Santa and Mrs Claus were there ;) and the place was packed. We loved the outdoor "porch" space and the music was great too. Not too loud so that you can't hear each other. The server was nice. We ordered the jalapeno poppers and the chicken tenderloins. I loved the smoked cream cheese in the poppers and the tenderloins were crispy, trendy and juicy. My husband was pleased that they had Guinness on tap and I really enjoyed the "mint to be me" cocktail. It was tasty without being overly sweet. We will definitely be back!

q3Ktu0OmRV6ScGG6m3tJeg.text: Outdoor patio with games plus terrific food. Loved the green pepper rings with dipping sauce. The sandwiches are full of flavor. Service was quick. Definitely going back with the whole family, something for everyone.

dOLv_cpxbV9GjTBOTKV0Nw.text: The negative reviews must be because this is a brand new bar with employees all learning.  I came here last night with my family and we had a blast.  Service was great. Food came out fast and delicious. I would highly recommend you give it another chance as we very, very much enjoyed our night here!!

K3WvKX003LuxLYrYohNrIA.text: Finally open! Got to grab dinner here last night, the food was great and had healthy options for my gf. Loving the vibe and the huge patio is dog friendly. A very diverse crowd different from what I usually go to in old town Scottsdale. We definitely be back with my pup  ~B~

h5-KWZAohGtYuDm4BLLqWA.text: I really enjoyed place. Staff very nice.  I had fig and goat cheese salad.  Omg so good.

UJZOkcdhEdL6yKKtJxHu1w.text: Slooooooow service; food is avg to above avg.For such a simple menu, you might expect better execution. The Carolina reaper sauce was a hit but by no means overly hot.

iaQOBMg9YFnviYe7iavDIw.text: I came with a girlfriend for happy hour on Thursday and we ended up staying most of the night! We had the nachos on happy hour special accompanied by many glasses of wine . The nachos were good,  the decor is super cute, the place was full of people having a good time ! Our server Kyle was amazing and we will definitely be coming back !!

8XBkQV6PvLhNEUKMSa9Q3w.text: We went there on a Saturday afternoon. The outdoor space was busy but they seated us quickly. We had two dogs with us and they immediately brought us water for the dogs. That is a plus as dog lovers. Had beers and appetizers that were good. Our server, was all over, she was amazing checking in at all time.

ZjdAwuYFYiZnt9k-X-cvKg.text: I have been coming to the porch for a while now. I always sit at the bar so I can't comment on the service at tables. I usually go with the wings which are excellent. However I went out of my comfort zone and went with Kerry's suggestion of the short rib tacos which happened to be on special today. Tacos were awesome.  She is a great bartender with tons of personality and customer service,  always fills my empty beer, and gives recommendations. This is my new Tuesday lunch spot.

k7QYTnUng9a6ngao4H5i8w.text: We wanted to like this new Arcadia spot, but it fell short of expectations. Most of the food was quite good, I liked the pretzel appetizer and the grilled cheese with short rib. When we sent something back the manager never stopped by our table to talk to us about what went wrong with the dish (chicken tenders- the breading tasted oddly sweet and moldy to me), and our server was clearly uncomfortable because she knew we were upset. We would have stayed for a nightcap and dessert but being charged for something we didn't eat or like because "it's so popular" and "no one ever complains about it" made us feel quite stupid.  It's a shame because the patio has a great ambience and we go out for a drink quite often. Unfortunate that the manager can afford guests walking out unsatisfied without even a table touch. I literally never write bad reviews- I'd rather contact the restaurant directly, (would have ideally preferred talking to the manager that night but it was clearly not an option) but when I called I was put on hold by a hostess and no one picked up the line after ten minutes. Too many pieces of the puzzle went wrong for us to spend our money here again.

hkaUNKKL5FfUgUybtZnq_w.text: First the positive, fun vibe lots of nice looking people the service was great waiter was cutie white boy with a beard . Drinks were good and so was the food. BUT my negative food is a little overpriced, and the music is way to loud it was hard to have a conversation I felt like we were just yelling at each other I go places to have fun with friends I shouldn't have to compete with the music in a restaurant atmosphere. If they just tweak it and make a few adjustments this place could be the spot.

jYHGKPsF-6Wk79aqk4rtlw.text: Finally got a chance to check this place out. Looks like they have really improved their service, we had great service from beginning to end. The jalapeno poppers and wings are great. I'm giving 5 stars but the ahi tuna tostadas need a makeover. The tuna has no flavor. Outside of that it's a great spot.

EWpEpWcQ1_5MIRFzqpIRnA.text: Nice atmosphere/vibe. Welcome to the neighborhood! The mason jar salad with short ribs and the chicken fingers and fries were yum!

Photo of The Porch - Phoenix, AZ, United States

KNBHsAWVeVUBQ5yQWlPAVQ.text: Loved the atmosphere here, fun and casual. The staff and servers are very friendly. Good variety on the menu too. I had the Mediterranean Chicken Pita, delicious. Our server, Lily, was really great - she went the extra mile for my mom who wanted champagne (which isn't on the menu), and she made it happen!

ejueG5t0g_fsFyPLA9PZrg.text: First time at this restaurant. No waiting  good atmosphere and our server, Kennedy was perfect with her attention to us. I had the wedge salad with short ribs and it was delicious. Would definitely come back and would recommend to friends.

TSi1pP7qJYPQ3xNOIFdz7Q.text: I came here for happy hour (or, happiest hour!) with my coworkers, interested to try out a place that I hadn't heard much about. Open-minded and ready for a couple drinks amidst tax season, we took our seats outside at a picnic table.   To start, we got bacon wrapped jalapeno poppers, fried pickles, the giant pretzel with cheese, and drinks. My fig mule was just what I needed. The Besos Calientes and skinny margs were very well received by our table. We polished off the first round of apps happily (the pretzel was my favorite, but everything hit the spot) and ordered round two: more jalapeno poppers, twice cooked chicken wings, and the short rib nachos. The wings were alright, but everyone really enjoyed the nachos.   We also jumped at the opportunity to try the tacos. One order of each: green chile pork, blackened shrimp, and braised short rib. Plus veggie tacos. YUM. All of them.   Service throughout was great. Our girl was friendly and made sure our drinks were never empty. When my friend and I decided to share the Porch burger off the happy hour menu (with a side of the truffle parmesan fries- which I wouldn't recommend only because the truffle was REALLY strong), it came out split and on separate plates. We hadn't even requested it that way!   Overall, we were thrilled and appreciative of everything The Porch had to offer. I can't wait to enjoy more patio drinks and eats before the temperature climbs any higher.

vjGEHtjSiGAIEyXH_CcWPQ.text: I've been hearing a fun vibe but terrible service...and that's correct.  Manager comped our beers cause we got our food before drinks, and it wasn't even busy. I was very pleased by that. ....but then, when waiting on another beer there was no waitress in sight. I originally went there to watch football. I asked for them to put my teams game on. Later without even asking they changed cause someone showed up an hour later and asked to have it changed...yet didn't ask me. Worst service ever!    Manager seems to be on top of things but staff is totally incompetent. Best was when I asked what domestic bottles they offered and I was told corona. I didn't think that seemed right so she then told me she actually had no idea. Hilarious! Do they even train people there?   Do yourself a favor and skip this place. This is a great area of town with way better options.

Kwa9RgChkLSt7KRr8y2bMA.text: I'm sure my review is different than most peoples. I love their breakfast. We come here every Sunday at 10 AM with our family and is a great place to bring your kids and order breakfast and have the entire or outdoors to yourself. Beyond that their breakfast food is amazing. I don't know that I've had a better breakfast burrito in Phoenix and my kids love the chicken tenders. I highly recommend her Risa sauce for the burrito it's very tasty and spicy. The service is always very good from our experience on Sunday mornings.

HaA3r1_utfdb2wEXhHgHOA.text: My date and I walked in about 7ish on a Friday nite. Packed Parking lot had one lone space- lucky us. Way too hot for "The Porch", we went indoors. The noise was deafening- I seriously mean DEAFENING! There was one tiny table in the center of the din- we opted to turn back never to return again. If you are between 18 and 30, this is the place to hang I guess- cuz it seemed like that entire age  Demographic was there. Checking out the menu online- it showed nothing unusual. But I guess it must have some "cool" attraction -we elected not to wait to discover it! Go at the peril of your eardrums.

ov7zLDo8Kp-qD0fOEiQ2cQ.text: First time here and I loved the pretzel and there grilled cheese with short rib! Also had the "Big trouble in Shanghai" mixed drink and it was delicious. Downfall so much ice. All in all, I will be back!

hrGgCqvykNyl8DBHrfQiAw.text: Currently sitting in the restaurant. Arrived at 12:08 and they promptly took our order. We mentioned we were on our lunch in hopes that it would hurry them. Nope.   12:43 and waitress just came over and told us 2 more minutes. But she has serious attitude because we now have no time to eat and we are upset.   12:46 food arrives. No bacon on my porch burger as ordered, but no time to complain.   I can only assume is the manager came and apologized for the delay. Comped is 50%  Food was ok. Didn't have much time to enjoy it.

Tnkry_03RQVNGva0iGH7yw.text: I thought it was really good- interesting food. Had a goat cheese salad that was tasty. Better than I expected. Trendy food and well prepared. The service was great- fast, friendly, helpful. I happened in the place just as happy hour was ending and the bartender made sure I had a chance to get a happy-hour drink special in on time. Had a couple appetizers throughout the night.  Everything was fresh and well prepared. I've yet to try the chicken and waffles.....next time

MoIJRpxl9Grkv-FFoGME4w.text: Wasn't too impressed with this place. Looks cooler from the outside. They have a self serve craft beer tap which is pretty interesting.

nhe4wYLpXjcKw9nDPgE08Q.text: We went here on a Sunday. It has the typical sports bar look and ambiance. Kitchen closes at 9pm. This was a shock!! The group left and decided to go somewhere else.

jqPzOYwi6v9x3J8qAxxxTQ.text: This place is cool in concept but in the end the food is good but pretty average. So for me, the atmosphere is the draw. The hubs and I went for drinks and snacks, I did like the jalapeno popper app. And the Reuben that we shared was meh. Nothing spesh. It was cold the day we visited so we didn't take advantage of that porch set up out front. They have a giant scrabble board which I would get into.

photos.caption: Photo of The Porch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Jalapeño poppers. Solid.

NU6b-a0GTo6buPVFTj1Odw.text: Visited on a Sunday around 11am with a couple visiting from out of town.    First...ambiance is awesome it's very open and has a great patio.  A fireplace separates the dining area/patio when the cooler temps set in. Parking in this area is usually a hassle but not here.  We pulled up and were immediately greeted by the FREE valet...woooohooo!   We were ready for a few bloodies and some breakfast.  Had the breakfast burritos and they were amazing...bloodies had the right spice and a large piece of bacon for stirring.  Nice touch!  Oh....and the beer menu.  Very impressed by the microbrews with a few of my favorites, Sculpin and Guava Islander.  We happened to run into the owner John and you just sense he cares about getting the details right and delivering for his customers.   If you're looking to support a local business that has a friendly vibe with great cocktails and food GO HERE!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Porch - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Porch - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Porch - Phoenix, AZ, United States

DVfrwm9iPqnx460mIyHYvw.text: I really don't care for this place. Cool building and atmosphere but the food is just plain bad. Don't want to take my kids here so its limited in that sense, and while I can justify meeting pals for drinks late nite, they're just too many other options (with better beer and drinks) that I'd prefer in the immediate area.

EcLIwGWAMFMrroCyKtimgA.text: Honestly I really enjoyed this place!!! Not sure what's up with all the negative reviews, I would definitely recommend trying it for yourself because I had a great time!   I went for happy hour, and we ordered a bunch of apps. We had the pretzels and cheese (literally so buttery and delicious), jalapeno poppers wrapped in bacon, French fries, bruschetta, and tostadas. All of it was brought out promptly and it was all so yummy! We also ordered drinks - I had the fig mule and it was so refreshing. I would definitely order it again!   The outdoor space is super cute and they have lots of games and TVs. It's right next to the street, but I honestly didn't notice the cars that much at all. They have high fences and lights so I barely noticed.   Our server was super friendly and attentive. He made sure our waters were full and brought out a dog bowl for our furry friend!   I would definitely come back here! Take all the negative reviews with a grain of salt because it might not have been ready to open when it did, but it's up and running and a great time now!

photos.caption: Photo of The Porch - Phoenix, AZ, United States

zbgCnqLqFZLgZnAtRaGQUg.text: Service is lackluster. After waiting 5 minutes at the hostess table we decided just to sit at the bar. That should have been our first clue to leave. Our bartender was fairly tentative when she was around. There were three bartenders yet all seemed to be elsewhere or just not paying attention. The two gentlemen next to us asked for a side of ranch...15 minutes later and still no ranch. When our bartender finally asked us how the food was I let her know that they had asked for ranch yet, never received it. It was about this time one of the gentlemen got up and walked over to the kitchen window and asked for ranch.  The food was good, but I wouldn't go back or recommend it to others. Really two star service with three star food.

photos.caption: Photo of The Porch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chiliquiles

y5k1MrTPapVAT-f9G_In0g.text: Linsy was amazing! She took great care of my friends and I on a Saturday fun day. Not only was she prompt and sweet, but she went out of her way to make sure we were accommodated. I would recommend this place to all of my friends and family!

9tN6Rxi2Wl9GgrrEg8jqfg.text: Happy hour ends at 6:15pm, so come early if your looking for a deal. Had the grilled cheese with short ribs and tasted yummy but small serving compared to some of the yelp photo posts viewed. My friend had the Mac and cheese and it looked really yummy. On a hot day, avoid sitting near the sliding door windows inside. The waitresses tend to use the service computer outside and they would rather air condition the great outdoors than understand that your patrons sitting near the opening are probably sweating their a$$ off because you left the door wide open 10x within a one hour period. I didn't come there to be your door man. Cool decor inside with ample seating. Nice outdoor patio, but kinda noisy since it faces Indian School Road. Need to try more drinks and other food items before I give this place a higher rating. Our server was cool though, so kudos to him.

1vnkBkG6M9BZOrjm9g1gDw.text: This is definitely a new cool, trendy bar with Arcadia vibes.   The decor is super cute, and hipster. The bar is huge with extensive cocktails, and basically any type of alcohol under the sun. I went basic and ordered my go-to, Pinot Noir but definitely would love to come back with a large group to hang and play games.  It was a chilly night when we went, and they graciously had outdoor space heaters (and a fireplace) but the music was OBNOXIOUSLY loud. Maybe not the best place for full on conversations, but great for a casual hang!

T5U-T91cz9MIswcFkEkxUw.text: Super pumped they came to this neighborhood, however we don't need just another bar. Make something we don't have. The only thing I found decent was the service. They have 300 employees but they all want to charge double. Really... chicken fingers with a side of ranch and buffalo, two double WELL Vodka sodas= $66 buck.  Hahahaha they charged me $4 for a side of ranch and buffalo. Each drink was $20. This place is a joke and that is HWY robbery. Why would anyone go there. *** Hey owner!!!!*** We aren't dumb, go rip someone else off!

photos.caption: Photo of The Porch - Phoenix, AZ, United States

1QEeIL_l5U63flm4rVQ8UA.text: So this place looked cool and some of my friends swear by this place in Arcadia. So I met some friends there for lunch and to shoot darts since they have a nice electronic dartboard. We sat at the bar so we could shoot darts and there is a bartender but she never ask me if I wanted anything to drink or eat. She is more focused on her boyfriend that is hovering over her every move. So at this point I figure well Im not giving this place any of my hard earned coin!! As we continues shooting darts the staff is giving us dirty looks for continuing our game. And we are getting stares from sone blue haired women there as well. So Terrible service and they cone off like its the customers honor to  spend money in their establishment. So I have an Update from the GM of the Porch so they offer service if you want anything you have to ask. I thought service meant they asked you if you would like a drink or maybe see the menu?? And i have never seen a bartender kiss a regular on the lips!!

WDGlaVXtlLRwJwm2OLYOJw.text: Went here with a group of friends, stopped in while bar hoping down Indian School.  It's fine to refuel and get food and a few drinks. But for a fun place to hang and listen to live music, or DJ, there's better places.  Do like it's in the middle of all the other places, grabbed some good Nachos.

_-0igs26ttBoueODa1ELvw.text: I live in Arcadia so I was excited to have a fun new cool sports bar with hopefully better than average sports bar food. I arrived around noon last Sunday the 3rd, I had trouble finding the NFL game I wanted to view, I did find a small vignette sitting area with two TV's, a gentleman that I assumed was in management, was kind and courteous and quick to switch one of the two TVs to my game. Shortly there-after, I was approached by a second gentleman, I assume another manager, he ask if I would relocate to the bar, he would then turn my game on one of the many TV's in that area, because he mentioned he had a large party that was waiting to be seated and he could put them in the area where I once was, I noticed 10 minutes later it was actually 2 people, and remain 2 people for the remainder of the time I was in the establishment, which was about an hour and a half. In this area there were two flat-panel TVs and enough space for 6 individuals, I easily could've stayed where I was, and the couple that replaced me at this location would've had adequate privacy. I ordered a bloody mary from one of the female bartenders, a gentleman bartender asked me why I don't like bacon, not knowing what he was referring to, I replied, I love bacon, he said "oh they forgot the most important garnish" and he placed a nice strip of bacon in my beverage. I asked the same male bartender if he could describe the different wing sauces to me and he said he had not tried them and didn't really have enough understanding to give me a description, I went ahead and ordered wings with one of the different and unique sauces, it took about 45 minutes to receive my order and once I receive them, they were lukewarm at best. Once I received my guest check I noticed one of the bartenders had taken her discretion and given me Tito's for a $2.00 up charge, which I did not request Tito's, The bill was adjusted. By the way, Windsor, St. Francis The Vig, & many establishments on Sundays do some great bloody Mary specials and even have bloody mary garnish bars, food for thought! I understand you're new, I've owned two businesses, but I always looked at my business in this scenario, if I were a hospital, I couldn't merely say "oh we're new, sorry we killed the first 30 people, give us a few weeks and will get it right". I think you have to get it right the day you open the door, this is why George Beale and the Hillstone restaurant group is so extremely successful.

N9R15cV2N-MKnBXj5vp72Q.text: Third time at the porch.  I really want to love it. First time went with family and the whole visit was ok.  The music was so loud we couldn't have a conversation.  We asked if it could be turned down but that fell on deaf ears , we called the restaurant to ask if it could be tuned down and the hostess had to go outside to hear on the phone. There were 7 of us , our server didn't notice one of our party didn't get her food until the rest of us were almost done. We were trying to get his attention, we could see his back talking to the people in the kitchen.  We asked the server if they could close the blinds as it was getting bright, same thing, he was back talking in the kitchen. Gave it another chance, The server was very nice, the music was not blasting.  We ordered Nachos with no avocado, husband and daughter have severe allergies, bet you can guess what green stuff came on the Nachos !!!  The music was perfect , actually had a great conversation with our teenager. Today we went in again , we sat down tried to speak across the table ...we left and went to a restaurant down the road to eat. We all go out for different  reasons, I want to relax , enjoy the company I am with and eat some good food and have a few drinks.  I don't want to compete with someone's playlist of music and yell across the table.

VTO1-aajTx3xRrRigxlr7w.text: I had really high hopes for this place as we go to the Bevvy a lot and get exceptional service there, sadly they didn't deliver AT ALL. First we waited 30 mins for a table which on a Friday night is expected and this place was packed! So I was hoping it was gonna be worth the wait. When we finally got seated the hostesses didn't give us enough menus we had to get up and ask for more, our table was still dirty, and we weren't greeted for over 10 mins. When the server finally came over there was no "sorry about the wait" or anything. We gave him our order for appetizer and asked for a round of waters, the water didn't come til after the appetizer was on the table! We ordered our food at 9:39, at 10:20 we finally asked how much longer it was gonna be. At this point the restaurant was pretty empty. Our food came out finally and it was cold and just lacking in general. Burgers were dry and over cooked, chicken panini was soggy, seemed as if the food was just sitting in the window. We kept having to ask the server over and over again for refills and he came over and dropped a pitcher on our table, like I'm sorry do you not have time to get refills we have to do it ourselves? We ended up asking for a manager TWICE. All around it was a bad experience. I probably won't ever be back.

j9-Lu5hLRszRBuo9AIEcRA.text: The food wasn't bad, but it definitely wasn't worth the money. With so many food options available in the area The Porch is a disappointment in comparison. The service was slow but the atmosphere is fun and worth visiting if you're just getting drinks.

_-G5cVAZNL11tJ2VC8TCDQ.text: Yikes- I really don't see this place lasting much longer with all the other great places in the area!  It's getting 1 star for decor/ambiance/location.  I should have checked the yelp reviews prior ugh.  Stopped by for lunch today with my husband. The place was about half full.  Nothing on the menu really caught my eye (sign #1 we should have just left), the waitress was very attentive but when it came time to order, she informed us that about half the menu was unavailable bc they were in the process of redoing it (sign #2 we should have just left, would have been nice to know when we sat down), ok, needed a few more minutes to decide what we were going to have instead, we decided on a fondue and pretzel app and to split a Rueben sandwich.  She came back and when we ordered said 'oh wait we don't have the pretzel fondue either' ok soo we ordered jalapeno poppers and a Rueben and my husband ordered a beer.  Our food ended up coming out at the same time (ok fine we didn't specify that we wanted the appetizer as an app) but my husband never got his beer.  We ate our food, bottom bread of the Rueben was soggy and the waffle fries were really oily, the poppers were really good.  When the check came the beer was included, the waitress was pretty upset that we never got the beer (she obviously didn't forget it, the bar did), it got that taken off.    If this was my restaurant and I was in the middle of a huge menu re-do, I would have managers walking around all day to each table to talk to people, apologize, maybe talk about the new exciting things that will be on the new menu, maybe even offer some sort of free appetizer, something to get people to come back once the new menu was out.

BXsbm1Pzp66loeXX7_pE_Q.text: I'm so happy this place opened! We had a great night, and Matt our bartender was attentive and kept the drinks flowing! We have been back twice, and haven't had a bad experience! Not sure why so many bad reviews, but we had an excellent time! French Dip Burger was to die for, will definitely be coming back!

FzDCt_RKlVUjwpNSmhe06w.text: Food was pretty good (for bar food) but almost $80 for dinner and a drink for two was pretty ridiculous for a bar.

YnVk2_7I6Y82rp-1kk6WYQ.text: Had lunch yesterday at The Porch great location The patio is well decorated.  It is however a little close to the street.   Food was solid and the service was excellent.

oHzF0u7EEOHeH-50npeDhQ.text: I was so excited to see this place as it was going up. For the last few months I have been passing by it on my way to a local school to work as a Student Teacher. Today was the last day I needed to complete before I graduated. My husband wanted to celebrate and take me somewhere nice to celebrate. I requested The Porch thinking it would be a perfect fit.  Upon we put in our name with the hostess. She warned us it would be a 30 minuet wait. It was a little chilly outside but we thought 30 minutes wouldn't be to bad. She took our name and phone number and told us there were games outside to play. We walked around looking for the games but they were awkwardly placed near diners and it didn't feel comfortable to step up. We looked around inside and saw a good number of open tables meant for small groups so I figured the 30 minuet wait would be accurate. We sat outside on cute lawn chairs and waited for the Text for our table. After 45 minuets my husband went to check on the wait time, he was told 6 couples were still ahead of us. I looked around the dinner and outside area and still saw open tables. After an hour and a half wait my husband went up agin and asked. We were told the only way we could be seated was if we shared a picnic bench with strangers outside. I was hungry and agreed. As we passed by their were still available tables inside that apparently we were not good enough for. The people next to us acted surprised that we were seated and while I didn't ask them I assume they were not asked if they would share they way they reacted.  So we sit outside looking at menus, no space heaters, no fire in the fire place. 15 minuets go by and no one comes. Finally a guy named Jeff stops by asking us if the food he has is our order. We tell him now and inform him that nobody has been by to check on us. He tells us very friendly that he will find her server and leaves. We wait some more and decided has finally been enough and agree that we will leave to go celebrate somewhere else. Jeff meet us as were leaving And informs us that he is been trying to look for server I can't find them. We tell him everything that went down and that Larios ready to leave. Jeff was very friendly and I bet if he Had been helping us in the first place the situation may have been different but it wasn't enough. I can't even write a review about the food or drinks or anything else because the whole experience was so bad I'm not sure what to even say more but avoid this place. I hope that management repress and correct the situation so that this can be the new addition to the community that I hoped it would be.

HcskvN7q9PIebaLqIZfR0A.text: Third time there. Great relaxed business lunch and the staff was amazing. I had the protein bowl and it's ridiculously perfect for a healthy lunch. So much better now that the lunch crowd has slowed a bit so I can park easier

-yFCDFkika3FzMn-Xq8zyA.text: Such a cute place with good vibes! The short rib nachos  & fig mules are always my favorites!

x7qLxw4Itw-wmE0RI5UKOw.text: Location and the outside is fantastic. Food is pretty good, but just like a lot of places like this it has limited options which are very similar.

sMW7PgrmchDQ9xKE49I1ag.text: i was excited to bring  my family in for dinner as this was a new restraunt in the neighborhood.when i walked in, it did not seem family oriented for one. number two, we were greeted by two hosts that did not appear very enthused. We decided to stay to give the porch a fair shot. We were seated in a round comfortable booth, not much to choose from the menu but we all made do. When our food came out it was all cold, except the kids meals.The waitress never came back however i was able to track down the manager she asked to repack the meal but we declined so she refunded part of the bill. When our waitress finally made it back to our table to give us our bill, we quickly put the cash down wanting to leave but we had to wait for our change. She took at least ten minutes to show face, so we had to ask another associate to have her bring back our change. when she finally made it back, she threw our change on the table and walked away. this was unacceptable behavior nor is this a restraunt i will ever return to. Terrible review from the host to the waiters.  by far the worst service i ever had. The talk around arcadia we are not the only unhappy customers

RcQwZPtpy5q39tjY6YiT-w.text: The atmosphere is great and is likely the thing saving this place. The server was nice and did well, but definitely over worked as it was packed. The food was terrible... chicken wings split in half and our entrees were cold when we got them with no flavor. When talking with a manager we just received excuses... no the food was not worth $15 ea. Oh, and they ran out of silverware so it was tricky to cut with plastic silverware. They do serve a mean corona light, though. Hoping this is just early opening issues, may try again in half a year if they are still open. On a positive note, Santa showed up!

photos.caption: Photo of The Porch - Phoenix, AZ, United States

9StfMXBLVHGDyXUrnndbQA.text: Place is badass, I especially enjoyed all the hot MILFs...   I sat at the big booth at the front door.  The table is extremely wobbly but luckily I buy all my tables at IKEA and not the porch.   Had the honey dnsnsbdhshs wings - I may have misspelled that.  The wings were phenomenal.  The drinks were spot on.  I also made a life changing discovery "Wall Scrabble"...  Congratulations to the owners on creating such a great concept.  The neighborhood is going to love this place.  It is exactly what we needed..

2gZp1P9ax4tlxY6CTWoRlg.text: Came in around when they opened at night and had a great time that evening. Finally came back in for brunch and the atmosphere is awesome, great food, great priced drinks and service to match! Fun games - bags and darts. Definitely recommend and will be back again soon! *****

snY_xRqIy0QlvvqMGnz_4w.text: I was here again this weekend and the same bad service. Place was packed but servers are not doing what they are supposed too, we had a girl with horrible attitude, food was OK not great.. music was good. Server brought the wrong beer to my friend and instead of apologizing she was trying to convince  us that it was the right one ! We know how a blue moon looks and taste! Please! --- service is horrible and I can see I am not the only one complaining about that! Too bad I really wanted to like this place! :(

8KL2o4PXqbR9t12cQiGA4g.text: Great place and an even better environment. I just had the wings and the french dip and it was outstanding. Would definitely recommend. The staff is very friendly and very professional.

9py9Wgv4cj8zBbgWfA1yKA.text: Went into The Porch this afternoon for the first time with a group of friends. We sat at the bar and were immediately greeted by Jessie. She was attentive and helpful going over the menu items. She had a great suggestion with the Mediterranean Mule~ It Was Awesome! We also ordered the jalapeno poppers, So Good! Great service, food and atmosphere... we will definitely be back soon!

i-clufMIWtk0aboeBzHieg.text: Nice out door and open area seating.  Not the greatest service. Food was decent. We will give it another try and post the review.

Qy94plIu8uw147szqS1-ng.text: I went to The Porch to watch the World Series.  The staff was struggling to get the sound on for the game and I wanted to make sure they could before committing to ordering something.  I also wasn't quite hungry yet and I let the bartender know that I would be ordering but it would be a little while. I was also expecting possible company so I wanted to make sure whether they were coming or not. The bartender asked me to order four times within 10 minutes and then rudely stated that I had to order something to stay. I got up and left. She was a complete bitch. Their menu is not gluten friendly anyway as it features couscous.   She lost mine and anybody I knows business permanently.

YvV5vVV01r1UWLkpUs2CVw.text: Initially thought the atmosphere was awesome and was super excited to try the food. The food was just ok, nothing amazing. I split the French dip burger with my boyfriend and he also ordered the poppers and a beer. Everything seemed to take a very long time. The waitress told him 15 minutes after ordering his beer that they would need to change the keg. When he asked for a refill, it took just as long. The food wasn't bad, it just wasn't anything to write home about. Poppers where very dry and the burger was just ok. The horse radish sauce tasted a little more like mayo. We are not in a hurry to return.

lvypbqSweXB6eh-JRLqlAA.text: Being a new neighborhood spot I had to check it out. My bf and I loved the food, but service was subpar for sure.

0zrTOuIsFMQxPuPBoxHqXQ.text: Stopped in once and it was super fun.  The outdoor area is pretty cool.  Tried the fried pickles and fries as a quick snack on my bad day and it was really good.  Not greasy and very tasty.  Staff was nice and the service was prompt, even on a busy day!  Glad they opened in our hood!

Ls8U_IK3Z5vsMziIjAqhEQ.text: I love this place - the atmosphere is fun and energetic- the AZ Green Chile burger is amazing - the servers are great - we sat at the bar and Henry took excellent care of us!! Highly recommend The Porch.

QikLCGViUJCbLMFnNgM6gg.text: Place is great. Good bar food. Great patio. Solid drink pricing. Awesome crowd. This spot is now in my rotation

ABnpLu-gtwWsMM1vnNdp3w.text: I went to the porch for the first time today. Everything was amazing! I asked the server to have a drink made that wasn't even on the menu and he was more than happy to do so. I had the border bowl and it was phenomenal. Logan and Allie were my servers and they had the most upbeat and positive attitude. I can't wait to come back here again!

cm19e7ax7ub1cZm-nQuFdw.text: We were excited to try the porch. Made a reservation Sat night for 13 for Sunday brunch. Upon arriving, all 13 of us were promptly seated...at a single picnic table. We moved the six kids to another table not reserved and heard the waitress mumble "what the hell do they think they're doing?"  We then ordered the kids meals - 5 of 6 arrived and they were out of our beer choice and wine choice. The avocado toast was good as were the breakfast nachos. Unfortunately, due to the fact that the staff was rude and the "Porch" is situated on Indian School, we will continue looking for our Sunday brunch spot

YSF14RNWjv6uDy21b-W-Gg.text: This place is terrible.  The server never wrote anything down so our food came out all wrong. Waited forever for drinks, had to ask for silverware and had to ask for a spoon to eat chili with......total joke and I don't recommend it.

UMPP9JODHFr49fCKRHaX2w.text: So impressed by the happy hour! Delicious burger and a beer for $10. Cool atmosphere, I will definitely return.  The only issue I had was that it took a little too long for the hostess to acknowledge me when I first walked in.

BeN9NpOVX69NJGbiFB9l6w.text: I was in Phoenix doing a training class and decided to eat at The Porch. What a great place. The service from the bar tender was amazing. Never an empty glass. The food was so good, I had a Rueben with sweet potato home fries and the pretzel with fondue. Everything was fantastic. The atmosphere and restaurant set up seems like it would be a happening place in the evening. If your around give it a try!

H2_Dt7tJo1wkA-ajbvS9ZQ.text: Surprise bday party here last night, they did a bang up job with the outside area and gave use the most amazing server....Kennedy just killed it!  Over 30 guests and she handled all the individual tickets without error and with a fantastic smile and attitude.  Incredible atmosphere and great people...definitely headed back.

wHSdsNxJuO209kTVfM_PHA.text: I really wanted to like this place and have given it several chances but the service is horrendous. I've been there at 3pm on Friday when there was 5 other people in the place--still took 10 min for them to notice a party of 3. Another 15 for 1 drink to arrive. Another 10 min for another drink to arrive. Meanwhile all the waitresses were just standing around talking to each other. The food is okay--nothing to be excited about. With all the choices in the Arcadia area, I feel like they need to step up their game. It's subpar.

EFiQ0ESiKTpKbJQYpqr7bQ.text: Tonight was our second visit to the Porch. The first visit was not great. The drinks were good and somewhat quick, but the food took forever. The manager "apologized and said they were new and working through issues".  Tonight my girlfriend and I decided to give them another try. We were seated right away and ordered drinks. It was nearly 20 minutes until our drinks arrived, and my drink was wrong. They quickly provided a new drink to me and then we ordered food. We ordered pork belly nachos, hummus, and wings. The food arrived in 12 minutes (quick). The order came out wrong and they agreed to correct it. The pork belly didn't taste or look like pork, but only pork is listed on the menu and not beef (I do not eat beef/cows). I kept questioning the pork, but with no beef nachos on the menu, I felt like I was eating a dry pork. It then took another 20 minutes to get a second drink - my drink was wrong, again.... The bill finally came and it said "short rib nachos" on the bill. I flipped and asked why they served me beef when it literally says PORK BELLY NACHOS on the menu, and was told "pork isn't on the menu anymore". Nobody told us that. The restaurant does not train their staff and has only one bartender to serve the entire seated restaurant. This place is a mess and I can only imagine what it looks like behind the scenes in the kitchen. I would avoid this place until they get their act together. The manager was nice both times, but nice doesn't equate to running a successful restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of The Porch - Phoenix, AZ, United States

HtnMJTaVeMSJBa7DXZ7zrA.text: Logan was OUTSTANDING!! It's so refreshing when a great atmosphere and eclectic vibe combine with top-notch service. As if that wasn't enough, the fresh food and $15 bottles of champagne really put the icing on the cake. What a great first impression!  We have since been back, and specifically requested Logan. Unfortunately, he wasn't working that day. Food and drinks were very good though!

V-P0j3FP-FPR3ZVoB1o81g.text: Had a great meal here on a beautiful Saturday afternoon.  Excellent Nashville Hot Chicken dinner; wife had a great protein bowl. Attentive, friendly service.  We'll be back.

hFspsRLLDAOZPuGMTuvEFQ.text: The place is really cool and the bar is great. We put our names on the waitlist to be called for outside seating. In the meantime, we found a spot at the bar. Lucky we did. We were never called to tell us our table was ready. We told the manager and they compt us a beer. Really? You would just expect better.

kXdhIA94xbu88N0HftL9Ag.text: It's nice to have another place to go in Arcadia with a group of friends. My friends and I went on a Friday night for dinner. We got there around 6:30 and only waited about 10 minutes before sat. The staff was very accommodating with our requests and made sure to continuously check on us. I didn't get to try much of the food that night, but the rest of the group had no complaints. I plan to come back for brunch next time to take advantage of their rose deal!

JYxttTyIJsFlGtUIRUppFA.text: I come here all the time and its truly a great place. The mason chopped salads are bomb and the chicken tenders are on point. But what really makes this place awesome is the staff. Josie and Kennedy are by far the best servers,they are just rays of sunshine and are so attentive. All the managers are very friendly giving the whole place good vibes. Loveeeee itttt!

gQYKPv6KW3B3AqYqebd-Iw.text: Kennedy was the best server ever!! We had a huge a group and she was amazing and kept all of our tabs separated even though we moved around. Would come back just because of her! Also love that it's dog friend.

0yZiQ3JEaXjWEG2fchhzzg.text: One of my favorite places to grab a drink on a beautiful, sunny Sunday afternoon! The atmosphere is guaranteed to get you hyped to have a great time. They have numerous games inside and outside which makes this place an awesome date afternoon/night spot or fun place to go with a group of friends. Service is friendly and usually on point. Unfortunately none of the food options totally draw me in to eat but I have enjoyed several of their cocktails and a they have a wide variety of beers. Definitely worth a shot and you likely come back for more!

kKvRd6UK9CcW1hBrthLTWg.text: Our first time here and we loved it! The vibes are great and our bartender was super sweet! This reminds me of a bar I would see back east! Great food as well! We will def be back :)

qdjlhMFdDuK66mmTLYohdQ.text: I tried to go here earlier this week with my boyfriend to grab some cocktails for the first time. The "complimentary valet", which also happens to be mandatory, said he would park our car for tips. I told him I didn't have cash and could I just park myself. He told me I couldn't do this and that he could accept tips via Facebook Pay or VenMo. I don't know who hires this valet company, but Porch you should maybe reassess. I really wanted to give you a try but I literally had to leave and find another restaurant to avoid being forced to pay for mandatory "complimentary valet".

72uYbdOeYRwsKo4RWUaHzg.text: Great Atomsphere , Good Service and Food !!  A little trendy with a hip vibe ... Younger Crowd , but no worries .... A little pricey but didn't mind based on service and food !!!! Check it out !!!!

MPnuQVkY9Z0sk-hzj1E26Q.text: This place does have good potential if the staff and menu improve. There was no check up to see how the table was doing, and our drinks were not refilled. The atmosphere is nice, but it's not a good choice if you don't eat meat. There were minimal options for vegetarians and the waitress was not willing to ask whether things on the menu could be substituted for something else; essentially no accommodations. I wasn't too upset with that because I know I won't be able to eat everywhere, but it was the waitresses lack of willingness to even ask if something could be changed.   I used to work in customer service so it's very important to me as a customer how the staff treats their patrons. I will only come here again because of friends that enjoy watching the game.

cd_GQYWDy9C11679iD8llg.text: Great food and service. My dad and I go in almost every other Friday for lunch and get the Porch Protein Bowl special which is delicious and reasonably priced.   As long as we've been going here, we've had the pleasure of being served by Kerry each time. She has a great attitude and personality and you can easily see why she has so many regulars sitting at her bar every time we're there.   As far as food, I tried the Porch Burger Just today and my wife tried the short rib grilled cheese. She was impressed and I dug the burger, definitely one of the best I've had in the valley.

qEoMxithgsquJwClosW8Hw.text: Amazing place for food, drinks and fun! We came in on a Saturday around 6:30pm so not too busy but you could definitely tell it was a popular spot. We took a seat at the bar and we were immediately greeted by Warner! Super friendly and attentive - made sure we were taken care off the bat and again when we came back around 10 after a comedy show (don't tell comedy - check it out!). But for real - chicken nachos were amazing but our favorite part was Warner - super awesome and there when we needed him! Going to be one of our main spots for sure!

keYqkey1FyEQsXY7NNebpg.text: Great neighborhood joint. 5 stars for vibes. I have been going since it opened. They upped there prices and there new happy hour sucks. Literally only a dollar off most everything on the HH menu. So don't worry if you don't make happy hour times ! Your not missing much!

NcIahIzpQwKOwWml9SzLYA.text: The food was pretty decent great spot to play outside games and watch the finals & meet new friends for a cool hang out spot. The hosts were friendly

d9omjKIMdMXQLygCLu6huw.text: Came on a Sunday.  It ended up being a typical Sunday Funday.  Good crowed. Great food. We just had the apple pie Alamode and a couple drinks atmosphere was good vibe with DJ and plenty of activities and games to hang out and challenge with friends. One star down was due to bathrooms were not nice at all. No paper towels and not so clean. But that's an easy fix.  The rest was awesome.
