82KZDVA0XzyHU62uyv2cQA.text: The food and service were great! I had a mint to be cocktail, which was pretty strong but a little to sweet for my liking! Although it being summer time, I don't think the air conditioning was on in the building. It was very uncomfortable. Could be a one time thing, would definitely come back in the fall to hang on the patio.

uEM55HzLN-cijXkknYATVQ.text: My wife and I went here with a group of friends for St. Pattys day brunch. The waitress we had spilled an entire glass of water in my wife's lap, and as she helped pick up the mess, instead of apologizing, she just said "obviously that could have been worse." We brushed it off and went on with ordering food. My wife got her omelette and inside was a big piece of plastic. The waitress took the food back and shortly after, again delivered the same omelette and stated "that was not plastic, it was egg white film." My wife has had her fair share of omelettes, she knows the difference between plastic and egg white film. Again no apology and the fact that that was direction they took it is embarrassing. You made a mistake and then tried to play it off like your customer is an idiot, nice! Finally, the bill comes, and after all of that she charged us full price. Cost yourself a tip and thanks for nothing.    DO NOT GO!!!

N_8GFFOuks3Nh3_9FmmP_Q.text: I have to give it to the Porch! My first experience was far from perfect, but they have really worked on their customer service. Kalie, behind the bar, is friendly and went above and beyond to please our small group!  The bar is comfortable and fun. There were groups doing beer bongs out of the cutest flamingo! With the open-air floor plan, the games outside and the beer bong flamingo, this place really does feel like a porch party.  The food was never the problem, but everything was delicious. The twice baked wings were even better the second time! I can't stop thinking about them and being paired with a beer suggested by Kalie - it was perfect!  I'm confident the Porch will be part of our neighborhood for years to come and I can't wait to be part of it's success!

T0EPSjpq989jY-HPZ22-Ow.text: Went for lunch with work people.  Cute place...love all of the retro decor and the porch is a great space.  Just too hot to sit out there at this time of year.    I had the chicken tenders with potato chips, we also had an order of humus and a pretzel with cheese dip.  First, the appetizers were ok...the hummus was fine and everyone enjoyed it.  The pretzel was good, tender and salty and the cheese dip was really good with a mild beer flavor.  My tenders and chips were good.  I really liked the homemade onion dip that was served with the chips and the chips themselves were excellent.  Crunchy and just good.  The tenders were good as well.  The crust was not too crispy and the chicken inside was tender and juicy.  I didn't care for the two dipping sauces that came with them so asked for the ranch, which was good.  Others had the wings, the truffle fries, mason chop salad, the protein bowl, and panini.  The panini was more like a club sandwich with a trip layer...got an "ok" on that item.  Truffle fries were good although one order was delivered stone cold and were sent back and replaced with hotter ones.  All in all, everyone said their meals were ok, nothing spectacular.  Sorry...no pictures this time.

hvQ3xa1rxJUxvzDjsqYP5Q.text: Entryway and overall ambiance is upbeat and positive.  Seat Yourself is tricky for me.  It worked out fine today but sometimes I get overwhelmed when places are busy. Service - friendly and efficient and coordinated, they all seem to help each other cover tables so we never felt neglected.  Menu - interesting and with enough variety to please almost everyone in your party.   Grilled Cheese with Short Rib hits it on several spots!  The bread stands up to the filling without being soggy or too "bready".  Beef and cheddar are old classics but the pickles and sauce really take it up a notch.  I went all in and had the Chips & dip as my side (at this point who am I trying to kid, it's Cheat Day All Day).  Take My Advice and order "as is" for maximum delight - don't try to second guess Chef, just let it happen for you on the plate and on your palate!

z7a4Ayr3BN_GlXzI-juNPQ.text: Great place. Great drinks. Highly recommend big trouble in little Shanghai. Good food.  Nice staff.

rFymvmu8p8zzLJniiWJq9g.text: Food was amazing- the salmon was cooked PERFECTLY. The French dip burger was awesome as well- a great portion size and had just the perfect amount of horseradish on it and came with crispy French fries. There have a great bar selection as well! Patio is dog friendly and the waitress was so sweet and on top of things- she even brought a bowl of water for our furry friend. Will definitely be back!

PMrR5HTvi5klCdh3hLbIQA.text: Great Sunday specials! The bottles of champagne were very tasty ~especially for being inexpensive! Our server, Kayla, was knowledgeable, prompt, friendly and professional. I'm a stickler for service and she was on top of everything; even during a busy brunch. Watching from afar the staff seem to have great camaraderie amongst each other and it reflects in the overall atmosphere. They have a DJ which brings the vibe up a notch as well. Indoor/outdoor, family and large group friendly, food, drink, great service, beautiful staff ~this is the place to be!

nb63dW-zLsjC_TuDYGEj4g.text: Food is great Atmosphere is up beat and fun Service is a little delayed but it's a relaxed environment so it never feels rushed. I have been here for 2 going away parties and 3 times for lunch and all experiences have been positive. Thanks!!!

BUi52K9AD-LTCYyLrZmHKw.text: The service was phenomenal. The waitress we had was so happy to be there and was so friendly! We went for happy hour around 4 and it wasn't too busy. Not in love with the mandatory valet but it was still a great time with good happy hour deals. There were vegetarian options, I got the short rib nachos with the short rib on the side! The atmosphere was fun and they had sports games on the TVs as well!

NKW9z-1vxI7NChvKXrq1Gw.text: Going here again today to watch the football games. Hoping for a good experience like the first time we went. Giving 4 stars just because the mixed specialty drinks seem a little steeply prices, but comparable to places like culinary dropout.

aX-Z_cK-o9QL4939amZzsA.text: I love this spot! Great place to watch a game or just hangout with friends! The food is amazing, great service and great atmosphere. 5 stars.

zF03474WUOxdYe6WwOABMw.text: I have been here 5 times since they opened a couple months ago. Each time I come it gets better. More and more people are finding out about this spot and the neighborhood bar vibe is excellent! This is the perfect addition to this Arcadia/Biltmore area. Thank you for offering a little bit of everything; a swanky atmosphere, variety of spirits, outdoor/indoor, delicious food even strawberry shortcake, entertaining games, 70's/modern like decor setting, spacious open layout with circle bar great for interacting and engaging with others, valet parking, happy, smiling employees, and so on. This is my new go to place and I can't say I've had a bad experience yet!

_AO9UsRFuyYsTt25whEJiQ.text: I wanted to give this place a better review only because the concept is there! We arrived around 6:30 on a Sunday and they were nearly out of everything on the food menu... I get the growing pains but to run out of basic food items is a little odd...  We ordered the pretzels and cheese dip. The pretzels were clearly not made fresh as they were completely cold/still frozen in the middle (they didn't end up comping these even though we notified them). My friend and I ordered some of the chicken tenders with wing sauce (because they were out of chicken wings) mine were completely dry and the fries were the consistency of the kind you might find on the floor of your car. My other two friends ordered the chopped salad. It was literally a bed of lettuce and maybe 4 or 5 toppings. The menu said it was $12, they were charged $14 AND $4 for 2 pieces of chicken....  Services was also horrible.  Really hoping they improve and can make it work!

OsaNcZybqfjuJcAVDS9rWQ.text: This place was so so good! First off the outside patio is super cute and relaxing. I had the double patty burger which was amazing and only $6 during happy hour! Their ranch dressing I used for my side salad was on point (I'm a picky with my ranch dressing) and service was great!

p7nmY8cphwbhTZl4qgmkIw.text: I have been waiting months for this place to open and it hasn't disapppinted. The food and drinks are pretty good. I've read some negative reviews about their service but our waitress Camille was fantastic. She was extremely helpful, warm and attentive to us and we were there for a while. This is definitely a great new yuppy spot in arcadia.

0dkIQal-JRDauHGS66di9A.text: Fantastic new bar in Arcadia.   Went for a drink and some food and was totally impressed.  The vibe is excellent, with nice big wooden bar, comfortable stools, great music, and great outdoor space.  There are so many TVs this will be the best sports bar around.  The selection of beers and food was fabulous.   Especially the wings which were the best in Arcadia.   Combination of great space and atmosphere, great draft beer, excellent service, fabulous wings, and awesome TVs make this new spot a homerun winner !!!  No other bars in Arcadia can compare

09D4vKqSBoQiKLMVlR_XPw.text: Stopped for lunch at the Porch when we first got to Scottsdale and heard a lot of hype about this restaurant/bar in Arcadia. Great staff and atmosphere. Our server Lauren was able to hold a conversation, knew the menu well and was able to sell us on some enjoyable short rib nachos.  Along with numerous craft cocktails.

5dwkdXE0ndVnNQZrevhn8Q.text: We sat fireside and enjoyed the AHI Poke Bowl (tuna was fresh-Chula seafood) and Short Rib Nachos.  The cheese on the nachos stayed consistently warm throughout the duration of the meal.  Lauren our server was the best, she was super attentive and gave great recommendations.

c7JpK_EU4H9V_ntAFUJT_A.text: Holly SH!t the waffle battered wings are orgasmically amazing. Service is great and friendly, a new Phoenix favorite!

inVyNHlDI1APr5V1Lskd1Q.text: Great location, great space, good vibe.  I want this place to be awesome.  Right now just OK. They need to work on inventory management and service.  Went on Sunday, table of 6. Waitress told us about $15 prosecco, brut, rose, special.  Wife orders a bottle of prosecco and is informed that they are out of prosecco.  I order an IPA, yep out of that too. Strike 2.  Finally got 2nd choice of drinks and ordered food.  Appetizers come, no napkins, plates, or silverware.  Had to ask 2 different servers for napkins and plates.  Food was again just ok.  Fried pickles-good, short rib nachos-good, poppers-complete ripoff at $9, pretzel-ok.  I hope they get it together.  Too much competition on that street to not be great.

HkfWnx4yC80LtkDApgJMTQ.text: Great spot to chill, our server Bruce was super cool we really liked him. Yummy food and drinks  100% would recommend

UZSh1TIHDx3Zh-2t02JojQ.text: Checked this new place out with some friends, loved everything about it, great atmosphere, food, and staff. It's a new place so as expected things aren't yet optimal but that doesn't take away from my rating! Loved it will be back soon!

vaDQG06khmyqjsbxzvM7og.text: Just found this spot and I love it! We received great service from Kerry at the bar and got upgraded to the formal glassware ! Are we at Steak 44! Check this place out!

6vIyumMwwlyPa85gVgEL7w.text: Fun atmosphere, great place to go for drinks with friends!the music is good, current and old school.

QaZOY_4Qxfsc3F7Z-XPicA.text: Love The Porch.  Friendly atmosphere great food.  Jessica the Bartender is fantastic .  Cute, friendly and knowledgeable.  Great combination!!!

LNvhaeQgfguAzsjmrJqzMQ.text: I've visited this place a few times and definitely felt it had some growing pains. The food and drinks has somewhat improved but the vibe sucks. I was really hoping this would be a nice new addition to the Arcadia neighborhood but the evenings seem to be overrun by drunk 20 somethings on the patio. There's also bathroom attendants which really give the place a "white privileged little crap" kind of touch.

8R217npzMBUH4mOWHnACoQ.text: So happy to have a great new spot in Arcadia! Sunday funday with great food and service by kennedy!  Try the poppers and the kale salad! Yum!!  Thanks f

kcod61dFVEYhIOyhL8Kh-Q.text: I liked this cute place but did not love it. The bar itself was cute and fun with outdoor porch swings and games. I was not impressed with the staff who seemed to busy checking their phones to greet you at the door. We literally had to wait for the hostess to stop texting and acknowledge us.

1mDxjWmPl43I-EdsJH_kYQ.text: I came here when the porch first opened and the service was incredibly slow. I am happy to say my second experience was so much better! We came in for brunch and mimosas and Logan took great care of us! He made sure our mimosas were always full and that our food was exactly how it should be. Thanks Logan for a great experience!

BMBM2f24CCTeBFQ54FNN2Q.text: Came in for lunch to meet my friend Troy M. who works in the area and the vibe was amazing. We sat at the bar and Kerry took incredible care of us. She suggested I try the Reuben which was absolutely delicious and my beer stayed full. The staff was super accommodating and I couldn't have been more happy with my experience.

photos.caption: Photo of The Porch - Phoenix, AZ, United States

8e9yaS2ZS6xtLr5jAtbY4w.text: Food is alright but overpriced. Service is decent but for how dead it always is when we go it could definitely be better. The DJ was rude, you are there for the CUSTOMERS, get over yourself. We asked for a song on today's hits not something from your grandma's basement. Even if you don't want to play it fake some customer service and move on. You're playing on a Friday night in a dead bar.

z269VeCayJe5KxKWjxnE8Q.text: Not your typical Vibe or crowd for this area felt more like something that should be on Mill Avenue. Food menu was extremely underwhelming service was horrible never got an actual tab just took my cash and gave me a change and the incorrect change at that. Don't waste your time here there's a lot cooler bars like undertow and the attic nearby.

-40IFuUc4K3jIQWkjtQhtw.text: Absolutely, by far, the BEST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER. The chef, "Paul", is outstanding. The food, phenominal!  You know it's beyond delicious when you are thinking about what you want to have the next time you visit and you're still eating.

ndvJccjmUidkMUQyFaG0fw.text: Obnoxious wait time. Horrible parking. Unreasonable prices. Terribly average bland food served cold. Terrible service. Nothing about this place was enjoyable. At least I have to only waste my money and time once at this atrocious place to know never to go there again. I wish I had seen the advertisement they bribed into the Fake News propaganda, I would have then known to take the negative reviews with honest seriousness. Be aware they are also strong arming Yelp to remove honest reviews because they are scared of the truthful experiences they provide.

ZV6rutowQNU8QfA2pgpIXQ.text: We had a great lunch meal at this  new neighborhood sports bar and restaurant. Service was great. I had the ahi Tostada and my friend had fig and goat cheese salad. Both were excellent. It was also fun watching Az vs Colorado basketball on the big screen TVs. Definitely two thumbs up.   .

EhM7iCxmef38NASKX8rkuA.text: Went to the porch for happy hour on the 2nd. Had a great server, was a very slow night at the restaurant but the young man was very attentive  and made sure we had drinks and appetizers. He had recommendations on what he thought was good  We didn't feel rushed to leave or anything which is nice. Drinks and apps were ok. Tried the fried pickles, chicken nachos and the soft pretzel fondue. The pretzel was the best out of the three for us.

EAIaIbLKd_kWhlhzcSDiWA.text: Really great burgers and fries! Hits the burger crave button for sure. My only complaint is the music is a tad too loud.... All in all its good to go. They also have valet parking. Pretty cool!

kXHxftq0-bTZRHdyi1ySkw.text: The downsides: overpriced food, limited menu, very slow and inconsistent shoddy customer service. THE MOST RECENT TIME I WENT, I, TOO, NEVER RECEIVED A TEXT FROM THE HOSTESS (just like another fellow yelper). Disappointed- I wanted this gig to be wonderful and exciting for my hood.  The plusses: Great decor, prime location...I want to compliment more, but it would be a stretch

OTx-QQgggmBoB1ECMJ5Iqw.text: This place has SO MUCH POTENTIAL. But wooof they had way too much bad to weigh out the good. Let's begin with the good and end with the bad:  1) The food. Holy hallelujah. We started with the bacon wrapped jalapeno poppers and the pretzels. Neither blew me away, but both were good. BUT- I got the French Dip Burger with a side of sweet potato fries and I can't rave about it enough. I think I finished it in 4 minutes with not a crumb to spare.  2) Ambiance!  Great out door area!! The decor everywhere is super nice too. Like even the bathrooms   Ok that's all the good.   3) We came at happy hour. We ordered the happy hour beer. Specifically asked for 'the one on happy hour'. Instead we were given the size up (which was $4 more) without being asked.   4) Just like every other reviewer says -The service was bad. We were served our apps without any silverware. Once asked for silverware, the hostesses took 5 minutes to retrieve it. My water was filled once and it was empty for over 20 min at one point. Also -The guy tried too hard - but not enough. For example, see 2). He 'figured' we would want a larger beer. He charged us all completely wrong and one of my friends twice. We tried to flag him down to fix it, but after 10 minutes, gave up.   I don't know - this place has so much potential but needs some major fixes.

GF0pf2S-tql321bCdzn-fw.text: I come to The Porch often and always have a great experience but tonight was truly exemplary, our bartender Kalie was attentive, friendly, and provided an overall great experience. The food and drinks were excellent. I highly recommend taking a visit to The Porch!

_YQP7-QlUvsuvWYYpW__SA.text: We had been wanting to check this place out since it opened, but the reviews were so bad.  We decided to give it a try anyway one weekend last month.    Pros: Nice atmosphere (inside and out), good cocktail (Cougar Bait), tasty pretzels with cheese fondue and a friendly staff  Cons: Super slow service...our server never showed up at our table, so we found two seats at the bar; however, our bartender disappeared for quite some time too.    Hopefully they can get the kinks worked out on the service side as this place has the potential to be a real success!

w5EvDHJn6jvBPcasGhBaLQ.text: Come here for lunch once every two weeks or so.  Very chill atmosphere.  The best part of this place is Kerri the day bartender.  Super sweet, friendly and manages a busy lunch crowd well.  I never have to wait long and the food is great.  I've had the French dip burger, the wings, the chicken strips the Mac and cheese with short rib, the grilled cheese with short rib, the tacos, the protein bowl, the poke bowl and the Nashville hot chicken.  Have been happy with everything I've tried so far.  Don't love the valet parking but I understand it gets busy.  Definitely recommend.

3VQni6FkuKFRY2XNcLCAgA.text: I'll start with the decent: our waitress was nice enough, the cocktail was pretty good, and the happy hour prices were acceptable*  The weird: we sat at a table with these faux Adirondack chairs which fit the style of the porch well, however the table was WAY too high for the low style seats. I am short, so the table was at my collar bone. My husband is tall, and was still uncomfortable. Seems like quite the sacrifice for style. Also seems easily fixable: lower the tables.  The bad: the food is terrible. We ordered happy hour bar snacks, and while expectations for finger food are always low, it was remarkably bad. The pretzels and fondue were definitely not house-made, but previously frozen pretzels and fondue from a can. It is easy to make a fondue, and a reasonable expectation for a restaurant to serve house made fare. The chicken tacos were edible, but the green salsa was like water.   *If the food had been even decent, the happy hour prices would have been a fair price. However, since I can buy the exact same food at costco and reheat it as they did, I find the prices to be extortion.

6FlLNhW1fvG3opc5SNTBCg.text: I've been here about 6-10 times and every time I am let down. My husband and I love sports bars and this place is a good place to watch football, but the service is SO bad. I am in the industry and I like to give people the benefit of the doubt but seriously these servers are the definition of subpar. There is no management on the floor as far as I can see so the servers just hang out and suck at their jobs. Today we asked one of the bartenders "are there any servers outside?" And his response was "yeah probably one of these assholes standing over there." So as you can imagine we left. Their head chef is good so they have pretty good food but it's not enough to have us come back. I would avoid this place and drive across the street to Cold Beers and Cheeseburgers.

Lx7UPglNdOSrJnZ0tAtJmw.text: Was really looking forward to this place opening, and brought the family on 2/1. Was hoping to see a few more Gluten Free options on the menu, but was even more disappointed when the server told us the GF chips are not to be trusted as GF since they are cooked in the same fryer as the non-GF items. That was a great catch by the server but a mis-representation on the menu.  Overall, the environment has potential, but service was slow, and menu options could use work. I take the under bet on this place succeeding unless they make some quick changes.

eaQW1CQS6zdq1HEwMdrDCg.text: Great food and well-equipped bar. The service is spot on, a tad slow when busy but not an issue. Well worth a visit, a regular spot for me now.

-m75Y9RKiCwbT6zT5kjZqw.text: The food was worth what they charged, it's not a dining experience. The mood is laid back, so much so that they don't let you know to seat yourself on a Tuesday night.  I got the Cuban sandwich which I though was tasty, my spouse ordered a salad that made no mention of dried fruit and yet it came with a lot of dried fruit which turned her off. I probably would have given it at least 3 stars if a member of the wait staff (not our specific server) didn't laugh in our faces when a little girl left a cherry stem on our table like we were supposed to take out the trash. Would have liked to leave a better review, but, I just can't.

C_hXPYGyHJ-gG-F7jNDssg.text: Was disappointed in the food and the service. Ordered pita with waffle fries. Food came, pita was in need of salt and the sauce drenched everything. The fries tasted fine but were cold. Others in party had the porch burger and enjoyed it, the grilled cheese and wouldn't order again. No one came to check on us until time to pay the bill.   Overpriced, mhh food, bad customer service.

nl9oVfEvcUEOAVco7BkR5g.text: We went for Happy Hour on a Friday.   Great selection of food and beers to choose from.  The Green Chile Pork Tacos -- sooooo flavorful.  Not a fan of the salsa they serve though.  Get there early - even with the "free" valet parking, getting into the location is a bear.

aXk-E7yusd93X7sLxNle3A.text: Amazing neighborhood spot much needed in Arcadia. Great staff, great food, and great drink ware. My new happy hour spot!  Thanks to whoever put this place on the map!!!!

lDRQ-33V_LMkmVkrG-6bpA.text: Not ready for prime time yet. One night they were out of food, another they ran out of multiple types of beer, no visible heat lamps outside, massive fireplace that is not finished, corner booth taken up by employees and looked like a mini office, etc. The drinks were great and the food was so so. This place needs to tighten it up quick. It's an amazing location with an amazing concept, but the experience is underwhelming.

pARqkqv-FdlXIQqmzdEjJw.text: I really was excited for this place to open.  Looked like it was going to have great ambiance and an awesome menu PLUS the new bar for Univ of Arizona Game Watches... amazing!  Turns out I was completely wrong.  I never tried the food because in the hour I was there, the hummus I ordered never came.  The burgers we were going to order also didn't come because the server barely came back enough times for us to place that order.  It took OVER 45 minutes to get one beer.  The best part is after I told the server to cancel our next round, the manager came over to apologize and said he wanted to make it right.  We stuck around for another 15 mins watching him NOT get us our beers, not rush out our food or assist in any other way.  Worst service and worst management I have seen in a very long time.  We will not be back.

ww6hh3f6DG9aSSg-dsb2sg.text: This was one of the worst places I've ever eaten in. I understand that they are new and need to work out some issues but when the wait is over 30 minutes for some eggs and toast, well, that's too long.  They had a menu which looked very good only to find out you can't order from that menu until 1pm. Then why put that menu out on the tables? Oh for the drinks on the back? Poor excuse, get a separate menu. Oh and how about having some salt and pepper at the table? Pitchers of water at the table would have solved our 10 person table water problem, rather than bringing one glass at a time. As it was we ate in shifts as the plates came out one by one with a waiter walking around trying to find out who on the patio the meal was for. So disorganized! These people need a lot more training.

gnFdcwZVfr-7fHYlxCF4dA.text: Absolutely the best burger in town!  We had the Porch Burger and garlic fries and they were amazing.  Cooked to perfection with a great sesame bun.  Tyler and staff are awesome!  Beautiful decor very comfy seating.  Just love this place :-)

jr8UON5Ld5Uvx24aW9zRUw.text: So very sad and disappointing.  Went there for dinner on 12/20. My husband and I were so excited for The Porch to open and were already planning having a party there b/c the patio looked so cool. Sadly, that will not be happening as the overall decor was really the only redeeming quality we found.  We were seated pretty quick, but from then on the service went downhill. We were a group of 5, we all ordered drinks and 2 appetizers. 1 person never got her glass of wine, and after 10 min we had to flag down the waitress from across the room, and then waited another 5 min for it to arrive. There were huge gaps in service and it took forever for things to come out. Finally, the meals come out, and they forgot my husband's meal. The waitress came over, noted that he didn't have his meal and left.  Over 5 min later, she returned, noted AGAIN he didn't have his food and stated that she would look into it.  Why didn't she look into it the first time she noticed that it was missing? Come to find out, the kitchen never made it. She said that she would them make it quick.  After another 15 min, we told her to forget it and my husband no longer wanted it.... Miraculously, it then showed, but at that point is was way too late. She said she would comp it, but, honestly, comping something that we said we no longer wanted is really too little too late. In almost any restaurant I have ever been to, by this point we would have seen the manager in order to better address the situation and at least apologize, but we saw no one.  My generally easy-going husband was livid at this point b/c we spent over $30 per person without his meal and she couldn't even throw in a free beer for him.   The food was mediocre.  I am gluten free, so I had the only meal option available in the Poke bowl.  Very rice heavy, decent amount of tuna, but only a small amount of veg and very dry due to minimal sauce.  My friend didn't like her chicken and waffle wings b/c they were drowning in sauce and wasn't a huge fan of her boyfriend's chicken tenders either. Husband never got to try his meal.... Finally, though the decor was nice and the patio cool, they left the sliders to the patio open and it was FREEZING.  Music was also too loud, making conversation difficult.  In hindsight, I should have looked the reviews b/c this seems to be a common theme.  I am sympathetic to them being newly open and growing pains, but just do the right thing by your customers so they leave happy.

QWH4QaRnAi2Qf6xa6YjJbw.text: Nice spot but mainly a bar scene. Surprisingly mediocre food. The burgers were actually poor, dry, underwhelming. Perhaps we're spoiled with great burger spots nearby. Unlikely to revisit

tpEnoAbjwGZLw1vM-yk-Pw.text: Not sure why this place has only 3 stars.... I was visiting over the holidays and stopped by for drinks/food with a bunch of friends. We had chicken wings were crispy and delicious, & the burger was cooked to perfection. I'm a big ranch connoisseur and theirs was awesome. Would def recommend for a group.

u2dbkTW3hB73yhr_u6po0g.text: This is such a fun place. Had a great meal and our waiter Logan was the best! The fried pickles were really good. I was so surprised. Of course the porch burger is always a great choice.

3Pdu9L3ZxTdzx35-g7rNpA.text: Atmosphere and drinks are great. Food tasted great. Unfortunate part was the porch burger. It looked like it was put together by a prior McDonalds worker or someone who doesn't care about their job. I cut my burger in half and all of the meat ended up on one side. Courtney was great! Very attentive and had great suggestions.

xKeRmGcKJ6BHZLekVjyyqw.text: I just moved over here to Arcadia and I'm trying to get my SoSco friends to love it over here too. So we decided to try the newest place in my new hood. Seated promptly, plenty of room, greeted promptly and I will say Jessica was very nice. They seemed maybe a bit overwhelmed although the place wasn't that busy. We ordered the chips and dip and was told they were out of chips. We decided on fried pickles ,which were great, and pretzels and cheese. The cheese sauce wasn't that great. All 6 of us ordered and had minor requests (no tomatoes or no sauce etc) and 2 of them were right. I would suggest telling your servers that if they're busy and have a 6 top with special instructions, to WRITE IT DOWN. No paper and pen is a 100% rookie move. Our server along with her busser kept the drinks full except for the 1 guy drinking beer at our table. Then one of our late comers ordered the poppers which said "stuffed with smoked cream cheese" which was not True. They were stuffed with cheese sauce and overcooked. 1 friend and I both had the french dip burger, mine had the horseradish sauce that I requested none of but she fixed it and it was just ok, the other 2 had the other burger which was like a big mac they said and 1 had the grilled cheese which she enjoyed with the chili. Nothing was mind blowing and in fact, we had 3 more people join us after we ate and we told them to go to the Vig and we left. As we were getting our stuff, I noticed a server walk by with chips and dip that we were told you were out of. I get it that they may have made more but we should've been informed of that because 4 of us had to order a different side with our meals because she said there were none.

icMhEX3YPxOYwIQiQelaqQ.text: Went to The Porch for dinner and loved it!!!! I had a burger and the mason jar salad. The food was so good and the drinks and service were excellent. The vibe is very cool but nice so it's a good ambiance. So excited The Porch came to our area!

3FwuYx6rF0kbAvVWQel-9g.text: The atmosphere is great, but the food is overpriced and mediocre. My chicken was well seasoned, but dry.

plb_fOYHRLMl9Z6Bei8Mlg.text: My first time coming to this restaurant was Friday and I absolutely love it! The food and drinks were trendy and delicious! We went during the day and it wasn't too busy. Service was amazing! With the help of our awesome server Jamie we were able to try a couple different cocktails that she recommended all were so good! Definitely will recommend to friends and family!

zTLKxfWR45VuG23UUoCxPQ.text: I am never disappointed with the porch! Food is always great. I haven't had an item i didnt enjoy yet. And I am still exploring the menu. HOWEVER my fav is the waffle cut fries! Yum! Always enjoy the fun atmosphere and seeing our favorite server Nicole D. The porch is a must visit.

HkXBJ3MIacD00tLs-2xS6Q.text: Such variety in the menu, they have something for everyone. Stop here today and try the apple pie dip - you won't regret it!!!

vP1iHAyqqgqvgN31ru442w.text: The burger and wing are amazing. The decor is great, relaxing and fun games. I believe all the poor reviews are due to the kinks still getting worked out. Will definitely be backs. All you uptight people need to chill and enjoy life.

l201AlbQ4aNuAoKBGe0hog.text: Food was great and so was the service! Our waitress Evelyn exceeded all expectations. I'll definitely be back!!

_T256m2uQMEfbc-06yzMIQ.text: the two male bartenders that were working Saturday night at around midnight were AWFUL! we asked for a drink and they made their bar back make it, who obviously has never made a drink in his life. The bar back was nice...not his fault that the bartender pawned his job off to him. The two bartenders were disrespectful, had a bad attitude, and didn't care about their customers. Never coming back again!

KF26ZDDhDejoqECXWZLlSw.text: Jess was a great bartender & she made awesome vodka sodas!! We had a great time and enjoyed her interactions with everyone.

7FIcliNGf4oZ_148nLnNdA.text: I go back and forth with this spot.. it's cool, but sometimes it's too loud..blaring.. inside.. why? We sat inside thinking it would be more quiet since there's games outside.. but the music was uncomfortably loud. We got a drink and left. However, if songs from 2003 are your fave, this might be your spot!  They have a yummy blueberry mule, but other than that.. nothing too note-able. Just another newer style bar..

qpjCDppVQyrOGe5AejNP-A.text: I can't wait to come back here! The atmosphere is comfortable and inviting, also I called before we arrived and the waitress was extremely friendly and informative.  We started with the porch poppers (jalapenos with smoked cream cheese) and the giant pretzel with fondue, so filling we couldn't finish the pretzel, so yummy. Super relaxing chill place, and we left about 6 pm and it was getting crazy busy. The food is great and they have an awesome beer and wine menu. The service was outstanding:)

wRHnipoe6BXMzC1GkX77lQ.text: Last night Went for trivia night The valet insisted " we have to use him" or park across Indian school The menu has changed and not for the better  The waitress never returned after taking our order Someone else delivered and she never refilled our drinks.  The Person in charge of trivia - the host in the bow tie  Came to tell us there was no Audio for the game and  He would not be walking around to collect the responses We would have to find him in the corner every three minutes  ... really   Food got cold while we were up Every three minutes   That is his job?  We asked the hostess when we were leaving  She said she has never had someone request the 22 teams deliver their responses To him and told us not to tip the valet.   Not the point !  We paid the check $33.00 for nachos a rice bowl with chicken and an ice tea Expensive and cold  The service and food has gone downhill Trivia night is a great idea The host needs to get his lazy butt up to collect the responses while WE the patrons enjoy our food as we are the customers.  It is Wednesday night -not even a weekend   If there is an open parking spot, we should be able to park our own car - we do it daily.  It should not be mandated by someone to have to park the car when there are 7 open spots.  Many patrons won't go to a place requiring valet, I often don't   I like to support local places but there are many good places to eat and this place really has changed and not for the better.

GUQuJAVg-aoHVFd1C8XFuA.text: Our first time here and it was just okay. Our server was Kayla and we all just didn't get off on a good start. We were served a dead guy ale and there was a long piece on blonde hair in the drink. It took awhile for Kayla to come around to check on us so we all waited! for the beer to be replaced. I ordered a porch poppers for a starter and it came out with our main food dinner.  Our server never check on us until a table busser came around to gather pit plates. Finally we got our servers attention to get our check. Of course the check was scattered and mixed up, so I got my pen and had to separate the check for her. Realizing, not one of our food was at least comped for the long blond hair.   Poor service okay food, you are more welcome here if you are a hot college student

q238ighQXrcmqdLuefTeMg.text: So came here for happy hour which was a good idea burgers are good anytime of day, the retro 80s vibe inside was cool, drinks and service are great aswell def will be back for happy hour soon

JWPUelX5RJeil8gdAWMoHA.text: We stopped in on a Saturday afternoon to partake in their brunch menu. I had the chicken pesto sandwich and my husband had the breakfast burger. The food was okay, a bit overpriced for the quality considering it was marketed as "brunch specials". The atmosphere was fun, the outdoor seating is nice and it appears they have a DJ on Sunday. We sat at the bar as we typically do, the service was decent, however, the bartender took my husbands drink before he was finished and didn't ask him if he wanted another until he was done with his meal. Overall we had high expectations for the Porch and unfortunately the experience was just okay.

KVuxrSF5voJEgslATEN0Hw.text: After seeing this neighborhood joint built over the past few weeks, I've been highly anticipating it's opening. I can honestly say, however, I was quite disappointed.   After being seated on the patio, it took about 10 minutes to be greeted and another 10 for our waters and bar drinks to arrive. Our server was kind, light hearted, and friendly, but his service skills left little to be desired. He seemed to have several tables on the patio.   I would describe our all round experience as "average." The food was exactly as describe, good, but not great. The atmosphere was lovely, the patio was a perfect spot at sunset. I may consider giving The Porch a second chance in a few months, hopefully they'll staff themselves a bit better and work out their new restaurant kinks.

3PFD-8VMRPYBg10jzEq_vg.text: 1st time checking the place out- I left without even sitting down. We stood at the front waiting to be seated...we weren't even acknowledged. Plenty of employees there. No hi. No welcome. No nothing.  A friend REALLY wanted to try their happy hour, so I gave in and let them have another chance to take my money. Thedrinks were mediocre, and the food wasn't anything to write home about. As a matter of fact, I can't even remember what I ordered. Go figure. The patio is cute though. If you just want to have a beer and watch sports, then they're alright. But if you want good service and memorable food: go somewhere else.

zGjAf2iiJv6hkxaI7FDJFQ.text: My visit to The Porch was decided on a whim. A couple of friends and I wanted to try their happy hour! Little did I know, we would find such a fun atmosphere. We sat outside with some drinks and appetizers (like the pictured nachos). All the food tasted delicious and all the food tasted freshly made. My favorite part was all the games that they had. We had so much fun playing jenga and trying to master the ring toss. I will definitely be back for another happy hour!

rHhgpl4cb1SWNaE_k-lldQ.text: Really great food but be prepared for the atmosphere if you are going for dinner. We went on a Friday night and they have a DJ and are pumping the music pretty loud throughout the restaurant. If it's not too hot and you want a quieter spot, ask to be seated outside. I had their short rib grilled cheese. Damn it was good!!

c4G1a7t3eub1t2ekD6yRDg.text: Stopped in for Sunday Brunch- this was my 2nd trip to The Porch! My first experience was amazing.. champagne and apps for a girlfriend's birthday. Friday nights are lively with a solid atmosphere. Brunch is definitely more chill. Always offer complimentary valet parking. $15 bottles of brut, rose or prosecco. If you plan on having more than one drink (most beverages avg $10), go for the bottle! I went with the bartenders suggestion of chicken tenders and sweet potato fries $12. They were good, but I am excited to get back and try the Brunch Burger $14. Perfect for a day date or HH (HH all day Monday)- excited to come back once it gets cooler so I can sit on the porch

sBTxUTOYYvFXXEb2yGz-hw.text: Alright here's the logic for my review:  Location/Ambiance: 5 stars  Service: 1 star  Food: 2 stars  Overall Experience: 2 stars  The way I would describe The Porch is pretty simple. You know when someone wins the lottery, balls the heck out and is broke again within a few years? That's how I would describe The Porch.  They have a great location, a great building, a really nice patio that is actually cool in Summer... and somehow they mess things up so much that you have no desire to return.  To come out and say, as a server, that you have the best wings in Phoenix with JT's less than a mile away and a Zipps less than a mile away is ballsy. Especially when your wings aren't anything to write home about. Also, I ordered a salad with a balsamic vinaigrette. There was no vinaigrette, it was literally thick balsamic glaze and basically inedible.  The service is absolutely awful as well, our server basically left us on an island the entire time we were there. I really hope this place sells to Fox or LGO because Royale Jelly clearly has no idea what they're doing.  At least they didn't mess up the cold beers.

6EmZUDY8YVwMmAWUDwvcgg.text: Pretty good food! A little out of the way for me but I like the atmosphere, and the food is pretty good too. Great place to meet with plans or to meet after work. Music is a tad loud.

photos.caption: Photo of The Porch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Burger fries and beer and salad

qs1dg5WShMwZg4CupsyaEQ.text: I've been here a couple times for happy hour (3-6:15 M-F), because they'll serve me a pint of Rogue Dead Guy (that's right, folks, they have it on draft here) for $4. Sold on that alone.   Right off of Indian School, the parking lot is pretty small for the size of the place. I've never had too much trouble coming after work, but I imagine it gets pretty dicey on the weekends. Walking into The Porch, it's definitely a casual environment and a good place to throw back a couple beers and some bar food. They've got a handful of arcade games (golden tee and the like) in a corner, in case you want to escape your table for a couple minutes.   Like I said, it's hard to beat a $4 beer special, especially when they've got Dead Guy on tap. The pretzel is also excellent, gigantic and delicious. Would highly recommend. This last time, I opted for the Porch Burger ($7 on happy hour). It was fine, not super notable--a little salt and pepper goes a long way, friends--but the bun was good. I don't know if it was just smaller because it was happy hour, but it was a pretty petite burger (and I'm a very petite person) that I probably would've been kinda upset paying full price for at that size. The fries were excellent, and I'm 100% a fry snob.   Will probably be back for happy hour, but not sure I'd shell out bucks for the burger again. Stick to the pretzels and fries if you're just looking for something to absorb your beer.

LRiDiuTR0I9mzG3y24mtcg.text: The porch can be fun but it also has a weird aggressive vibe with lots of drunk people that I didn't like. It's too loud and it was hard to get our waiter's attention. Ordered the truffled fries but they weren't golden Brown at all very very pale and were just OK.

MRYzTWsgZqU_WztF0WUPlQ.text: The Porch lives up to its name, being a fun, low-key gathering place for people of all ilks. Often busy, the bar and restaurant sees a lot of different kind. Clientele is almost invariably happy, as they offer a good mix of drinks and food to go along with the outdoor vibes. Whether you want brunch, happy hour, or late night, yard games or Instagram pics, The Porch does a lot to please! My personal recommendation is the "flabongo." Don't ask. Just get it with a PBR tall boy.

eWG8RgTe2FhJ5qhn0SagcQ.text: Great place, great gals and food, BUT it is always at the bottom of the list for us because of the annoying valet parking.  Not only are you standing 15 feet from your car watching someone pull it up while waiting in the blistering sun but it takes forever if there is a group of you leaving because they only have one valet person.  Plus, I do not want a stranger in my car.  So like I said - great place but low on the list!!  VALET is so 80's

vyHW7787ZxN5dxMJj97FNw.text: The short rib and grilled cheese is a must to try hear. The bread is perfectly toasted and so cheesy, the short rib was melt in your mouth and so lean (no fat at all) finished with nice size slices of dill pickle and their house made bbq sauce. The truffle parm fries are hand cut and perfect amount of crispness. We also had their Az green chili burger ... grass fed patty topped with green chili pork smothered with smoked cheddar and caramelized onions. our server was awesome.. attentive, friendly, knowledgeable and very attentive Great casual atmosphere for some grub and margaritas.

photos.caption: Photo of The Porch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. short rib grilled cheese with truffle parm fries and a yummy medical margarita.

YMoHgbGEeiKXfFdn4roeEA.text: I've been to the Porch three times now and all experiences have been pretty great! It's the perfect spot for a happy hour, a casual dinner, or late night drinks.   Food (4/5) The menu has traditional bar food items with a bit of a twist. They also have some healthier salads and grain bowls (The Porch Protein bowl is delish!). All items range from $8-$15. Also, the cocktail menu is awesome with lots of delicious, unique options. My favorite is My Ex-Wife Secret - cucumber vodka, watermelon syrup, lime juice and soda water. They are dangerous!  Service (4/5) I've had two different servers and they were both very friendly! They do always seem a bit confused and unable to answer some questions, but they are typically pretty attentive.   Ambiance (5/5) The vibe is really great here! I love that it seems like more of a neighborhood hangout instead of a dingy bar environment. The outside patio is super cute with lots of fun bar games - bags, Jenga, etc.   I'm glad there's a new restaurant and bar to add to my Arcadia rotation!

Dn9iLhDQ_KDQF5zO8lkZfg.text: Have to give them that 5th star. Wings back on the happy hour menu, $6 for 10. These are excellent wings. All taps during happy hour $4 a pint. Service is a lot better now too.

IOrCYOT7FX04jSlScKNurw.text: Great place, food and our server/service was awesome! I had the Reuben with truffle fries and man, that Reuben was mouth watering and fries were good. Great atmosphere and place overall and definitely will come back.

CI4CnunotccVqa5iWo-gEQ.text: Really great food for happy hour. Only bad thing was cheese for pretzel dish was kind of cold. Service was great but it got super busy so it tapered a little. Understandable. We sat at the bar. Will definitely come back.

6-yIop60T9ZHUc-ET4d93A.text: Pretty good experience last night- the giant mules ($40) and the pretzel with cheese were great! Super fun vibe and very accommodating to our large group of 8. Service could have been faster but they were packed so understandable. Nice addition to the neighborhood!

z3D9SOgrE9NcJm22IOUJLg.text: Here with the girls, cool hangout! Logan is def the best thing going on tonight! The music is a little too loud for good conversation, the food was a 6/10 not a fan of thick tortillas but the shrimp was great!! Next time we want to sit in the porch!!

qPYSABzT4rGX27U3A6N92A.text: First time at the porch and it did not disappoint. I've heard both positive and negative things about it so I jumped onto Yelp, read some reviews and decided to give it a go. The service was fantastic and the food was great. I sat inside and they had on an abundance of sporting games on which was great. Great ambiance and overall feel. We will definitely be back

NLugcv10zscVg5W3-FANAA.text: Had dinner with friends for the first time last night. For a Saturday night it was energetic and seemed like a great spot it was crowded but there wasn't a wait. Parking was tight they use valet but we had taken a LYFT so not a big deal. Ordered drinks those were good and fair priced. Dj was playing place had a great vibe. The table ordered a burger, wings, the short rib nachos and a bowl. Everyone tasted everything and we all agreed the food was mediocre at best. The short rib nachos were actually kinda bad. The short rib was so dried it was close to beef jerky and it didn't look great. The service was very good I don't remember our waitress name but she was good, attentive and pleasant. I almost gave this place 4 stars because I really liked the vibe but I just think for 4 stars the food has to be good.  I would come again. Probably only for drinks with friends def do dinner somewhere else. I know this place is new so my hope is that they are still working with the menus and chefs.

Ug-WWcDvv_janEX4abkZ-A.text: Jami was the best server I've had in the Arcadia area and the most accommodating to our large party. She made us very happy with every request and made our large group feel very comfortable. We love her and will be back to the porch just because of her incredible service. From- the boyz

cT9vBLiCdKx8cKRi2TlDRA.text: Amazing spot to find.  Parking is a little rough but well worth it. Lots of things to do, and the patio is fantastic.  Food was spot on and so was service.

DSHApM6l6wPchH5UDokSxw.text: I can't vouch for everything of the menu, but their pearl couscous protein bowl is a winner. Most places who have good bar food wouldn't have this option for clean eating, so on this meal alone they get five stars from me.

I would recommend this as a go to for patio bar fun...

vuY2bkbyLPFbuxSsIHdCwQ.text: Awesome food and service. But the valet parking is stupid. Not efficient. Really dumb to make patrons deal with awkwardness in this cashless economy of tip guilt.

EfGk4PPJd5g92yHF6Ed1fA.text: I sat at the bar. Great atmosphere. The BEST burger I've had in a long time. Dare I say the best in Phoenix? I think I dare.

iE9KUMfk5OGarw_42icI5w.text: Order the Hot Chicken!! I'm from the South, and have been to all the original spots in Nashville (Hattie B's etc.). I know my hot chicken, and this is the best hot chicken that I have had in Phoenix, AZ. Sorry Lucille's and Starlite. My fiance had the Protein bowl and that was delicious as well. Great spot for food and drinks and a cool vibe.

npqCL6zykkll4rK6JSKtog.text: We are so happy to have you in the neighborhood love this place great food great drinks amazing customer service

dekzmQOElLfPSVBROQ2NNg.text: Literally the best nachos ever! Great atmosphere and amazing crew. Our server Christina was great and beyond helpful. The location is prime and I can't wait to come back!!!

l3VgPKqSe_1u0jDw5lsUMQ.text: We have been here a few times, during the week and an early Sunday afternoon. We come for the impossible burger which is awesome! Each time we go they cook it better than the last. We've been to cold beers and cheeseburgers and they cook it horrible! The waitresses have always been great even when they are noticeably busy and overwhelmed. Although, I used to be a waitress so I am more patient when it comes to service. The one waitress even remembered us from a previous time visiting.  The food and drinks have always come fast. The only time I was not satisfied with The Porch was when we sat inside and could not even hear ourselves think the music was so loud (it was not busy AT ALL). We ended up asking to be moved outside and were much happier. We will definitely be back but always on the patio!

44tKxmxkpTKOja32Z8UHCA.text: There were a lot of great things about this place, but I would say the food was mostly average. I really liked the atmosphere with the restaurant flowing into the giant porch. It felt very comfortable. I also really liked the chairs for the high tops. They were very comfortable and the same chairs were around the bar. Overall the food didn't stand out. We had fried pickles, a burger, and fries. I'd say the burger was a bit dry, but I still enjoyed it. The fries were described as shoestring but they were not very thin, just normal fries. Regardless, they tasted good. The waiter provided good service but it was sparse. He only came to take our order and pick up the plates. If he had returned we would have asked for waters in addition to our drinks. Also, we didn't really get any napkins, that would have been nice. Overall  a great atmosphere, mediocre food, and mediocre service.

eNPfao8pqGi-O54Ubi7A5g.text: Ok this was my first time here. Just passing by. (Lunch) Nice sports bar if you are into that sort of thing. Ordered my hamburger more towards the well done side came the opposite.  Didn't saying thing since it would have taken to long to fix it and everyone else would have been through eating. Being right on Indian School of course it is going to be noisy. Would recommend eating inside. Also has a dog friendly patio. I own a dog but do not like eating with him.  I will eat here again but inside this time and see what happens.

HpLqCnPSxE4DW9MCHOQsPQ.text: Plenty of shade, dog friendly, and our server Nicole provided the most holistically-perfect customer service in my LIFE (and I lived I Tucson, capital of gastronomy). We split a personal prosecco bucket, the twice baked wings, and brunch burger - AHHHMAZIIIING. Thank you for a great experience, dope food, and the best service in Phoenix & beyond.

ABn7PNktmYeozsnkn9zAPQ.text: After seeing the fantastic retro sign and open air seating, I was excited to go to The Porch. We went on a Sunday afternoon, and the weather was perfect for sitting outdoors. The place wasn't overly crowded, and we had our pick of tables. Our server was very friendly and had a great personality, but disappeared once we were served food. The pros: the outdoor area is nice, and a decent place for an afternoon beer. It is along Indian School Rd however, so when motorcycles go by, it is pretty loud. The negs: beyond the retro-themed sign and motel chairs, the place is more of a bro sports bar (if you are thinking it will be more like an Upward Projects or Genuine Concepts restaurant, forget about it). Inside has a few retro fixtures and yellow booths, but the main focal attraction is the huge bar in the middle of the hyper-air-conditioned room. Not only does the retro-theme fall short, the menu and food leave a lot to be desired. The menu selections are uninspired and pricey. My companion had a sloppy joe, which he enjoyed. Not being a meat eater and not in the mood for a salad, I selected the Poke Bowl. For $15 I received an anticlimatic bowl of flavorless white rice, a scattering of tuna, some chopped up cucumber, and some avocado. Knowing what I know now, I would have stopped by one of the countless poke restaurants in the area before going to the Porch, and spent my $ more wisely. If you go to the Porch, go to hang out with your friends to have some cocktails in the outdoor area. Don't bother with the food.

UAVxLHA_LaMVtvo_PeCQXg.text: Great experience at the Porch! The staff was friendly and the food was excellent! Our food came quickly, exactly the way we ordered it and the server had a great sense of urgency. I would highly recommend!

QmZcyKwZx0tTIqWHTwqBYw.text: First time here and was ONLY satisfied by the food...service and management on the other hand a BIG negative and definitely ruined the experience. On a steady to slow Thursday we received below par services. Our waitress only took the time to do bare minimum while going above and behind for 2 other tables nearby. Ask for a "SIDE" of beans and got a small ramekin of cold beans(if that is serving size it should be explained to avoid confusion and disappointment) along with some other minor mishaps. After receiving the service we received we tipped according to service, which was POOR. Now while sitting and enjoying the rest of our drinks, management had the audacity to approach our table to ask why we left the amount of tip we left. First off, that is probably the most unprofessional way to treat a table after spending money on the FOOD and to judge off a tip that we based off of service was uncalled for and definitely shouldn't be welcome in a restaurant environment. should definitely think twice about approaching the ONLY minority table there, when in fact the main FOCUS is the Customer NOT the percentage of tip the server deserved! Remind you I am a server and knows what it takes to serve and knows what is deserved. The whole situation made our table of 6 very uncomfortable and uneasy. Any guest asking a server anything shouldn't feel like they're bothering them.. not a warm welcome accompanied by bad service.. wont be there again and wouldn't recommend unless you want some good hummus and/or your white lol

966oVjjUtHehwczY2y6ngg.text: Awesome atmosphere. Been here a few times. This past time has been our favorite! My husband and I sat at the bar and Paul took awesome care of us! I told him i wanted a spicy margarita and he asked how spicy... I told him spicier the better and he came back with a few other bartenders to see my reaction. It was the best spicy margarita I've ever had! He was so much fun and so personal! Awesome bartender, went to the back to grab fresh jalapenos to make my drink the way i like it! We will absolutely be back! Best marg I've ever had! Thank you Paul!

x7I76KOwHAUYbloN1YUyuA.text: SO disappointing! How anyone opens an average restaurant in this neighborhood I will never know. Too many good restaurants in the neighborhood to go back here. Service was okay, food was sub-par. I could go on but it doesn't seem worth the effort.

ixg_ppjpK52PaGUG91-4aw.text: A great new addition to a fun part of town! The atmosphere is amazing as it combines retro nuances, with new vibes I would expect in a fun modern gastropub. We started off with an order of poppers and they were honestly the greatest appetizer I've ever had, and the wings are to die for (try the Carolina Reaper sauce!!). For dinner, we had chicken tenderloin, a protein plate, a poke bowl, and a Rueben. Everything was absolutely delicious, and I especially recommend the Rueben! The best I've had in Phoenix! However, the greatest part of the entire experience was the service. Not only did we receive our food quickly, but they went out of their way to make sure our drinks never remained empty for long. I will absolutely come back, and am excited to see where The Porch goes next!

7jlkKftr-W_Jtk6DoMiUnw.text: I was greeted warmly and sat at the bar, our bartender/waitress was hailey, very personable and knew the menu inside and out . I ordered the chicken chop salad which was fantastic, came in mason jar with a pesto ranch dressing. Reminded me of cowboy Ciao chopped salad. Even had the privilege of meeting owner the legendary uncle ron ron. I will be back, great atmosphere, great service, awesome food, and ownership group

CxKWQ8IfQZFhlwkwDPcYBQ.text: Great place & great vibes! Loved our waitress Christina, she is amazing! Also check out their chicken nachos! It's to die for.

XW8IVqNK7va9F2RcqDhOiw.text: My new favorite spot!   I met two business associates at The Porch for lunch and what a great find.   The Rueben sandwich was so good, I may go back for dinner.  A welcome addition to the Valley food scene.

JsrrJT3UpT-CV1UDRBRDJw.text: I literally have PTSD from this place. Don't come here after the sun has set. Food is fine. Beer is served in plastic pint glasses. The people that go there are THE WORST. Imagine a bunch of the most basic girls you can think of with their boyfriends still trying to live their frat daddy glory days. Pure amateur hour. Drunk people stumbling all over you before 9pm. Awesome. We were at a table eating when this guy at the bar kept leaning and trying to set his drink on our table for a few minutes. Finally, he fully stumbled ONTO our table. We told him to get his self together. Of course he got in my friend's face, trying to fight him. Once he saw how tall my friend was, his friends quickly jumped in to break it up. His friend explained that he was "part owner" of the bar. Uhm...what percentage are we talking here? He's a child. Imagine a bar ran by the worst people you knew from college and all their friends go there. That's The Porch. Can't these people go to Mill Ave and Old Town where they belong? Let us adults live in peace.

8bZS6zJvlS5txveFR21Yww.text: This is amazing. I've never tasted such a great porch protein. I'm bigger so they brought It in a tiny plate but It was all worth it. I'm coming back for sure

d5yBCsKoiSZz71vb8fnR0w.text: We had a great time. I loved seeing vegan and gluten free menu items, the patio is perfect for Phoenix winter days, and we got great service from Kyle. We'll definitely be back!

q63cVMwAojPlqO1hLM5yCw.text: I don't know what some of these people are talking about, my experiences were great!  I've been multiple times now and love the place! Super friendly staff and the vibe is awesome. Fun games to play including a jumbo scrabble.  The patio is perfect for this AZ weather right now, we sat on the cute vintage furniture, hung out with our dog while we enjoyed our drinks and apps!  Music was at a good level and everything is fairly priced! If you had bad experience here I suggest you give it another shot. :)

RJSighkNv1sgSdtIMTZryw.text: The food isn't that good. Kids fries came out cold and too any dogs and I would come back. Sorry!

k79-SnoLeVkBXokyMQdMKw.text: I've been looking forward to trying this place out and I am so happy that I did! The cocktails are unlike any other place around and the food (esp the Reuben and chopped salad. Make sure to add steak!) is great! Tons of tvs and outdoor games to have fun for a Sunday funday or date night! Our server made sure we always had full drinks and we're happy with what we ordered. I'll definitely be back to try out some more menu items soon!

7ZPwHcauve_M1SANLkcMgA.text: If I could give this place zero stars, I would.  It took over 30 minutes for our drinks to come (one of which was the wrong drink) and the food came out about 10 minutes apart, with another order that had been messed up.  Worst of all there was zero accountability.  All the employees seemed to know the service was horrible, but didn't care or do anything about it.  Our first waitress handed our table off mid service because she had forgotten the entire order since she didn't bother to write it down.  The manager was made aware of our issues, but didn't even bother to address our table even though we'd been told he would come over.  And what did we get for this ridiculous meal that took over an hour and a half?   A $180 bill for a table of 4 with two rounds of drinks and lunch.  Save your time and money and don't bother checking this place out.    I've worked in many hospitality environments and I'm very understanding when it comes to service, especially in a new establishment, but this place is a total joke with no excuse for the way we were treated.  I'm actually angry my friends and I wasted any money here (and I've never left a Yelp review in my life-that's how ridiculous this place is).

_66rTqPMH2XZIbz37LG-pA.text: My husband and I were so excited for this place to open and unfortunately, it's been a disappointment so far. The food isn't great and the service is pretty shotty. First time I went with a friend and it took 45 minutes for our dinner to come out...all we ordered was tacos and a chicken bowl. The chicken in my bowl was extremely over cooked. It was actually hard to cut it was so tough. Second time at the restaurant, my order was wrong and my hubby's "hand breaded" chicken tenders tasted more like frozen chicken fingers. He said the chicken tenders at McDonald's are way better and much cheaper. When my correct order arrived, it was pretty bland (med chicken wrap). No flavor and the sweet potato fries were so fried that they were really too crispy and lacked flavor. Once my correct order came out, our bartender disappeared so I wasn't able to ask for any hot sauce to give the wrap some flavor. There is so much potential here but unfortunately it's falling short. Hopefully it will get better. Also, the music is really, really loud so having a conversation is tough. I do hope they can make some changes to their quality of food and service.

8Wpd6dpdVUQ0c64BMSfIVA.text: I live right down the road from Porch and have been seeing the construction over the past few months. Today I noticed they were open, so my colleague and myself decided to stop in for lunch. Great decision. We started off with the shrimp ceviche. It was super fresh and had just the right amount of kick with the peppers. My colleague had a mason jar salad which she enjoyed, but the real winner was the Ahi Poke I had. The tuna had that deep red color, meaning it was super fresh. The sticky rice was prepared perfectly, and all of the toppings were fresh and delicious. I had to go back to work, so I wasn't able to enjoy their extensive beer selection. I counted 16 taps, about half of them are some of my favorite beers so I see myself coming in for quite a few happy hours in the future. Jess and Allie were spectacular startenders, hope to see them in the future! This is a great addition to Arcadia, glad I'm in walking distance!

i4peg_8gCwHOWM91ucEPug.text: Lindsey was so sweet and we absolutely loved her. The vibe is fun and the dj on Saturday makes it that much better. Definitely coming just to see her...

_1wyoeZyJPDgrKUZNgMcQg.text: Holy shit, Kerry was amazing and had SO MANY great stories!! If you live in the area, or even if you don't, hit this place up, u won't regret it.

Ai12SvTqfWnM1pm4Vv7oIA.text: Great ambiance, friendly customer service, delicious food, creative drinks, great happy hour discounts. Yes, I will return to The Porch although I do not care for the restaurant name.

ySllXH2hK8OawMXpYM7HhA.text: Service was fantastic as usual, even during the peak of the NBA playoff games first time we came.   Loved the cuban sandwich,  the golden wings are usually my favorite. Both times I came my date had the French Dip Burger and its excellent.  The horseradish gives it a great kick.   If the weather is good you can sit outside or grab a table.   We found two seats at the bar on our second visit.   They have lots of TVs to see your favorite game.  Overall like the vibe and decor.  Also make sure you  leave a few extra minutes for parking since they offer valet.

IEwdNNc0g2qkkxQZ-21dWQ.text: The Porch is our new favorite local hangout. The wings are sooo good! All the food we've had has been really yummy.Great happy hour with good beers. Love the open ambiance. The manager was super nice trying to get the MLB game we were looking for. He said they didn't have it, but we're soon getting the MLB pkg, so should get all the games. Servers/bartenders have all been really efficient and nice. We do try to avoid coming on Friday & Sat, as it is way too loud and packed. We come during the week which has a more relaxed chill vibe. Also, always great tunes playing!

E9E5mbFfmrVer3X4KA520g.text: This place gets pretty crowded, as it's still pretty new to Arcadia. I like the decor. The tacos were pretty good, but the old fashioned was pretty bad. They need to work on that recipe.

rMvjS1nWCfsXipOfB4dR8Q.text: Really good food!  Wonderful atmosphere and love that they have a dog friendly porch area!

3jm_SK1MnEvwFJDNOmSlgA.text: Here for a work holiday party. The atmosphere is very nice. Large outdoor seating area with giant jenga and bags to play. There are 6 different area heaters so it's not too cold outside. There is background music, but it's at a low enough volume to allow normal conversation. The food is fantastic, favorites were the burger, wings and hummus. Our server Logan has been amazing. He's extremely personable and polite while keeping up with serving our party of 20. All around, 5 stars. Fantastic experience.

4_k4N_pctvuZRRhiXJcSmw.text: I really want to give this place more stars but it was awful. I had the poke bowl. Half the rice was crispy and clearly overcooked, dry, and leftover for many hours, 3 pieces of avocado and oddly colored tuna that was not fresh. No water refills until 40 minutes after we arrived. A friend had waffle wings which had so much breading that the breading was  falling off the pieces of chicken. All the fries were very old and overcooked as well. A third friends burger was so overcooked it was hard to chew. If you are charging so much for food then make it that quality otherwise realize you are mediocre awful bar food that needs to be re-priced accordingly. Will not be coming back. I would have asked for a refund If I wasn't with a group of friends.

1XKbo9PTLyXTVO-8fHo2Tw.text: The food was good. The service was great and so was the atmosphere! Music was great the whole time. Our waiter Logan was one of the best I've had in Phx.

FzRBBUGuMfTl2WcGj9CadQ.text: I stop in here from time to time when heading home from my office....absolutely Love this place, great atmosphere, great food, and even better service from Kerry!

OF6apCvBmJUUUaB4ot7n7w.text: I had the fig mule drink (yum) and fig/goat cheese salad. Was awesome!! Husband ordered Porch burger, he said it was the worse burger ever. I tasted it and it tasted just like a cheeseburger. He said it was bland, no seasoning. Logan our waiter saw that he barely ate it. He told him what he thought. Logan apologized up and down, also about service being slow. But there was a table of ladies in the center that every time Logan walked by, they were asking him to do or get one thing or another which I believe delayed him getting to our table. I saw nothing abnormal with service. Then Eric the manager came over and wanted all of our feedback. Which was awesome. We both talked to him (good and bad) Logan asked us to please come back for another try because he thinks they could make it right.

0K5AQuRGoiDlU7aBSWIhSA.text: First time here.  Awful awful awful service.  Undercooked food. Waited 25 minutes for a beer to be delivered.   Waited 30 minutes for food.     Waited 25 minutes for the check.     So not returning!

bczjUsFkRmG-5o-gqeMvvw.text: I love the food and atmosphere of The Porch!!  The menu is so yummy!!. I love the hummus 3 ways and Kale salad! As a vegetarian there are great options!  I can't wait to try the impossible burger plate.... a vegetarians dream!!!!

sUx4LftpueISp7UBkvTkAw.text: Favorite hangout in Arcadia! Really fun but chill patio atmosphere with games and different seating styles. We always bring our dog and the staff is really friendly and accommodating to her. The blueberry mule , parmesan fries as well as the short rib nachos are a must try!!!

JLqJrvn4tdlZW2RmVt4N4g.text: This is a new spot in the neighborhood. The food is ok, left much to be desired. Ordered the Az Green Chili Burger. Had no flavor and needed more seasoning. Beer selection is good. Waiter got upset that we asked for separate bills but if you have any common sense you would know that 3 single dudes don't want to be on the same bill. I would go here more for the bar experience definitely not the food. If you like trendy superficial places this is the place for you.

fLGCUrsQgWV5C369zja7aw.text: My husband and I sat down at the bar and were swiftly greeted by Kerry, who offered us the daily special followed by a run through of some favorited menu items that did not end up disappointing! We split the Porch Burger and Porch Poppers - delicious! Also great company and overall great first impression of this place. We will be back again and again!

O8H-QullOVrGWJoEGirLNg.text: Come see Josie!! She hooks up the flamingos and bottles!! Great drink specials too on sundays!

Y5IpvNCCUjXIE7Tx7AEdJw.text: We have been driving by for months and finally had a chance to stop in this past Saturday.    We love the valet parking!   We ate out on the patio, which is a really fun space.   The service was excellent as was the food.  I had the meatloaf and my companion had the french dip burger.   Prices were very reasonable for the area.   I see this place becoming a habit.  I highly recommend giving them a try.

1uswbWffBXdTc_MFmhaATg.text: DOG FRIENDLY!! It's a super cute place with bench swings! We had the jalapeno poppers which were different from the Midwest aka not breaded  but they were sooo good! The cougar bait was good (drink). Our server was very nice!

9ieGuKqCqbgYn7zqfADmtg.text: This place is great!! The ambience is super chill and the bartenders treat you like family. On the Friday night I was there, there was a DJ who was pretty good as well.   Food- kinda pricey but TASTY and lots of options! We got the impossible burger, hummus plate and truffle fries! All delicious!   Drinks- the Paloma was very refreshing and the strawberry lemonade was nice and sweet!   Final thoughts- Will be back!

iaRqJYUoRsfXFuxF3CbHBQ.text: This is a charming place with excellent food. We went there for Sunday Brunch. Great service, great drinks, and fabulous food! Bloody Mary was spicy and yummy.  The mulemosa was great as well. I recommend that you check it out!

1Sa-XHlFNGnNBTEGWmjALA.text: The concept of the Porch is brilliant! They have a great dog friendly patio, roll up garage doors, life size Jenga, Plenco ,Scrabble and a decent menu with a decent happy hour! All the young waitresses are in lullulemon and Daisy Duke t-shirt knots and fortunately follow the old saying "spandex is a Right not a Privilege"  I brought my dog and sat on one of the picnic benches and when I looked around the grounds I realized how dirty it was! There were cigarette butts, candy wrappers, food and trash in the surrounding bushes and on the astroturf lawn....  a neighboring dog from another table kept trying to eat the wrappers and cigarette butts.... it's gross!  With all these young kids working there someone needs to train them on what clean is and when to do it......

eMt2Gm0ZBj-SOieBv5azcA.text: Went here on Tuesday during happy hour, the drinks were really good (jungle juice), the NACHOS  super delicious, and the golden bbq wings were also very good. Lots of after work folks, good service- would def recommend. In the cooler months they have games and a nice patio outside.

5hHHtGJk4hyidGAMpmJh_Q.text: Spectacularly mediocre. Service of a dive bar with the newness and prices of a higher end neighborhood bar. Save your money and go somewhere else with staff that actually wants to be there to serve you.

_u4ZcAdnKhn8xmOYGNMo3g.text: Pretty decent gastropub style, decent offerings, Slight hipster vibe. I had the Impossible Burger Bowl, which was surprisingly satisfying, and consisted of quinoa, grape tomatoes, asparagus, impossible burger and a side of aioli with fresh avocado. Lots of custom drink options, and plenty of draft options.  Update, meant to hit 4 stars and accidentally hit 3!

8jOtzTxHnFnu5GF6E-QFwQ.text: Stopped in for an event which we just missed. Vibe is great, music games and energetic staff. The bar chairs are super comfy! We didn't get food but menu is vast and they have a brunch menu on weekends. Happy hour till 7p.

l2zkbxda9f8ZLEb8PN2tLw.text: I like the atmosphere here relaxed casual ,food is good, service is slow tho, could have just been that day. But ill be back!

2dygJTt8K2lalmgreJ_6KQ.text: Feedback seems all over the place for this joint.  I'm guessing it is mostly because people weren't expecting the kind of place this was when they walked in.   We weren't but we were ok with it.  This is obviously a happening spot for the young mid 20 to mid 30,s spot.  Loud music. Good looking girls serving you.  Etc.  we came early for a quick snack and a beer so it wasn't crazy busy.  Service was great.  Food was good. Had three diff apps (happy hour!). The wings, chicken nachos and the pretzel with beer cheese.   The wings were great. Some type of honey/soy/ginger sauce.  Was the servers suggest and I really liked them.  The nachos were great.  We would def come back. I'd like to try their sandwiches.   But as we are 40+ and old as dirt, I think we will stick to coming before 7pm. :D Haha!!

VO7OGuZ8UxTXQzRnJz0czg.text: I would come back here just for the chicken and waffle wings. They are packed with flavor and the spicy maple syrup that you pour over it makes them even better.   Service was good. We had to wait a little while for our waiter to come back between trips but we managed.   We also tried the breakfast potatoes and the truffle fries. Both very good!    I liked the atmosphere and the staff. If you're looking for a great brunch spot don't hesitate to give this place a try.
