yFTxWAKW7Wi6O29AjeJvqA.text: $13 for 7 wings. I won't be coming back here again. No additional detail needed just writing this because more words are required ok bye

x2iR4IiXbAZF7F7nZc3N7A.text: Pretty straight forward neighborhood restaurant and bar.  They have happy hour from 3-6:15 and the $4 pints of craft beer are a very good value.  It would be hard to find a $4 Ballast Point Sculpin anywhere else in town.  The Porch burger with fries was OK.  Nothing special one way or another.  There are a lot of dining and drinking options in Arcadia and this place is comfortable but doesn't really stand out.

6_QxB-CSXj_3G7Dnn6lknQ.text: This is a cool place and has a lot of potential. The problem is, our drinks (skinny margarita) were nothing to order ever again and they were out of both shared items we ordered. We tried to order the roasted cauliflower and then the boneless chicken wings - out of BOTH! so we got the chip duo ... chips were stale. We informed our waitress, she was apologetic but didn't offer to comp a drink or really do anything else for us. Sad because we enjoyed the vibe of the place but we won't be back nor recommend.

iurkIj9t1XWybLTzWqCwuA.text: This place is cute if your looking for a place to hang out and JUST drink with friends the vibe is "ok" which is why I'll give it one star. With that being said... we ordered three separate times in which every-time the server came back to let us know they were out of the item. We decided not to order food anymore and go with drinks. We ordered the skinny marg which tasted like it came out of the tap, and although there was ice it tasted warm somehow. The cherry on top was the dead moth we found in our game. Safe to say probably will not be coming back.

8pxraSrG7tupqQtscp19lQ.text: This bar/restaurant gave us the worst dinner we have ever had in Phoenix.  I should have sent back a tiny piece of salmon and salad that was barely edible, and over $15.  And they managed to make a grilled cheese sandwich with no flavor.  Is there a chef??

L3tWaRgoUA4_DHUayvEdLA.text: What a great find The Porch  is! Great food drinks specials staff is friendly and they have 100% grass fed grass finished burgers! Which is AWESOME! Wish they were closer to Gilbert!

photos.caption: Photo of The Porch - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Porch - Phoenix, AZ, United States

3w_iADmCWEJduO2gQ4ixJw.text: Went here a couple weeks ago during happy hour, it was actually a great experience! The drafts are all $4 which is a great deal, on top of the different happy hour food options. I got the baked pretzel and my bf got the burger, both were delicious!! The parking is valet only, so if you want to tip, have cash on hand. The inside fills up pretty quickly and there's some shaded areas outside.

eTw8e0oLtlPksu3Q9irdxA.text: This is an update to my last review after visiting The Porch initially when they first opened. After returning they have definitely improved their service and the food. I ordered the same thing as I did on my initial visit. Can you guess it?!? Wings! Wings! Wings!  This time around they were good well (last time they were cold and over cooked). I think the kitchen has finally figured it out so I'm happy I returned.   It's a fun place to visit, they have a patio and indoor setting with a pretty nice TV set up to watch the games. Based on my most recent visit I would now recommend this place. They've stepped their game up.   My disclaimer: The first time I visited I was with a pretty big group. This last time I was with a smaller group and was at the bar. I'm honestly not sure if that made a difference but I could tell from the overall atmosphere that they definitely figured their ish out.

VQL8gV6bq-W41KRv_xU6LA.text: This place is freaken awesome !!!! We had great service!! Where should I start !?   We ordered the waffle battered wings, French dip burger with truffle fries and several cocktails. Which turned out to be amazing !!! I never had wings with that sauce it was sweet but not overly sweet which went well with the chicken and for my first time trying a French dip burger ! Holy cow it was amazing!! Our waitress was fast and responsive regardless of the amount of people that were there ! It was busy night great vibes and atmosphere !

yvuykZdYLAR3xUK35gqgPw.text: The food was served cold, no one acknowledged us for about 10 minutes after sitting at the bar, service was terrible. At one point there were about 6 waitresses standing around in the back laughing after I asked if my frittata was supposed to be served cold. I was really looking forward to a new restaurant in Arcadia but the porch has service one step above the service at farm and craft in old town.

iCk-LS87Fm1pEcbTNvr_zQ.text: Love this place, dog friendly, love the feel and the ability to eat outside. It's a nice little spot and been there several times. Highly recommend going there at least a few times before casting judgement. Cocktails could cost less, my only turn off.

photos.caption: Photo of The Porch - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Porch - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ogGEDn3HGVD0L4wZF9hO_Q.text: If I could give this no stars I would.   I went here 4 weeks ago for dinner with my two sisters and my friend to celebrate my friends birthday. We all walked up to the hostess and mom friend asked the waitress how long the wait was hostess said about an hour. We told my friend if she wanted to stay, she said way. My friend told the hostess we would like a table and the hostess ignored my friend completely. So I step forward as I see another hostess walking up and I look at her and say we need a table for four then that's when the first hostess said oh I didn't know you wanted a table and I then said yes my friend told very clearly and you ignored her. She didn't say anything to me and felt embarrassed that I said that in front of the other woman. After that we continued to have rude service when we ordered our drinks at the bar. While we are our dinner a manager walked out from the back and asked different if everything was good and he walked by our table and just gave us a dirty look and continued walking. He didn't both to ask if we were doing good. He walked by our table two different times and he just looked at us like we were a piece of trash. After we paid our bill we walked out to leave and the same manager guy walked out behind us and I saw him and told my sister that he followed us out. I said this loud enough for him to hear and he acted like he went out there to talk to the valet guys. That manager guy acted like we stole something from the restaurant.  I have always wanted to here because it looked like a cool place to go. But since it is so close to Scottsdale they treated us like trash. We will not be going to this restaurant again.

hFrDbdwfJVpFv7UkL9JIXQ.text: I was excited to check this place out but was underwhelmed. The good....cocktails were great.... the bad.. the food and service was ehhhh. We had to wait and ask for everything...napkins, water, another drink. Granted the place was crowded, ppl were standing around right next to our table sitting their drinks on our table as they waited for seat. If the food was better I'd probably go back...

photos.caption: Photo of The Porch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Short rib nachos

nKGrzHnnlTxSsHixLEcp_g.text: Super cool vibe, great service but uhh your kitchen needs a 101 on French fries... first round came out cold. Not even Luke warm like they were under the heating lamp. Just cold. Sent them back got them back and they were microwaved or since they apparently don't have microwaves they were thrown back in the fryer. Parmesan was completely melted, fries were hard as a rock. I've been in the industry long enough to know better.

7hqgq_Z2txOAQdLHL7BcgA.text: It's as if the wait staff and bartenders purposefully try to avoid eye contact with customers hoping they'll go away and not actually order a drink.

XMnbuqVvJ88qAVlz7oQzZg.text: Let me start off by saying Great Place!  Besides the awesome food menu (a great dish for any mods your in) the service and especially Kerry our bartender was amazing.  Not only was she very knowledgeable but she was kind, on task, friendly, and made me feel like I was a regular even though it was our first visit!  I will definitely be coming back for the amazing menu and hopefully Kerry :) the rest of the staff carries themselves in a manner to which I would the standard at the Porch is great.  I got the burger and jalapeno appetizers which I would recommend to anyone on any given day!

rn6naGIHPd43C77hGPUGOg.text: Great titty bar! If you're looking for a place to bro out and watch intoxicated women in crop tops flash their tits then this is the place for you! The management has the situational awareness of a hibernating polar bear and will continue to pour shots for people who are obviously way too drunk and will do nothing when those people throw drinks in your face. As long as they get good reviews and likes on IG their completely happy with the outrageous behavior of their guests.

7UTpL042XJ_UmnPSgEMGHw.text: First visit to The Porch for an early dinner.  Six of us were seated promptly and server was there immediately to take drink orders.  (We all had water, so I can't comment on the beer/wine menu.  I'm not sure I even looked at it.)  I can't vouch for the rest of the items on the menu, but the Mason Chopped salad was excellent!  We had four kids with us who ordered the soft pretzel and loved it.  The beer cheese was really good.  The only thing I didn't care for too much were the stereotypical Hooters-esque servers.  Big boobs, exposed bellies - not so much, thanks.  Lots of people are ok with that, which is fine.  It's just something to take note of if you're dining with early-teen boys.  It was a little distracting.  :-)  Parking is really tight.  About 90% of it is valet.  The Porch is still pretty new, so we'll definitely be back to see how it evolves.  It has great potential.

6kuSDiAiaHZJtWrQ6Ly9zQ.text: I came to visit my sister in Arizona and she suggested we go out to this restaurant. I had never been before and I have some fave spots in AZ to go to, so coming here I was blown away with how much I loved the place! The atmosphere was so nice, and our server Allie was really nice and seriously helpful at walking us through everything on the menu. We ordered a few specialty cocktails and a variety of things to try, and I was pleasantly surprised by all of it! The cocktails were so bomb, it's definitely one of my new favorite places. Can't wait for my next trip to Arizona to go back.

ZKWRPFAVXq368bPvoloj-w.text: This place was great. Never really stopped in before but have always driven by their neon sign. Our group decided to give it a try and we sat at the bar. Ty took good care of our party and answered every question we had. Awesome spot to chill & have a couple cold beers. We'll be coming back for sure!

LVXS4NnPXF9IM0hD6ojzQw.text: Allie was my server at The Porch when I visited with my boyfriend. She provided amazing service and was smiling every time she came to our table. She made sure the burgers came out as we liked them (which were some of the best burgers we've ever had).  I received complimentary valet for my car which was also really convenient. The food was great and the staff, especially Allie, made the experience of eating there even better!

1042mBN_Ok-q3BgyWceMLw.text: Went for Tuesday special  Pork Tacos,  they are great!! good service ,friendly staff!    Great food! Doug in Scottsdale

xcZGyppivyjVQe3g8QCtIQ.text: I went to the porch last night to watch the ASU/UofA game. Based on the 2 star rating on yelp my expectations were pretty low. However, I was pleasantly surprised. Our group came in at prime time requesting a table for 8. We were told it would be about a 2hr wait, within 30 min we we're seated.  Our excitement quickly turned to disappointment when we were sat outside next to a large fireplace with 0 TVs in sight. Above the fireplace seemed like a perfect place for a tv. A manager said they haven't put one up yet because they feared it would be vandalized. We made do, occasionally standing up to watch the game on one of the TVs inside.   Our waitress, Christina, was great. She greeted us in a timely manner and quickly brought out waters and drinks for the table. Our table ordered a variety of apps and all were good. The restaurant was busy, but Christina kept our drinks and bellies full. She kept track of everyones separate tabs with ease and did it with a great attitude!  I recommend everyone giving The Porch a try regardless of the Yelp reviews. We will be back!

xoheVcNMYcOVEnCKve-GGA.text: Best new spot in Arcadia! Fun games, great drinks, and great food. TVs galore for all those sports fans and a great patio too. Family friendly but also great spots for day drinking or a date. Meets all your needs.

photos.caption: Photo of The Porch - Phoenix, AZ, United States

anm-GBF2EPLJb8OfYOelLg.text: Just tried this establishment and the wings! Amazing! Will be back just for those amazing waffle wings! Had to get the servers attention for the extras like celery, etc. Also please let people know the iced tea is flavored!

FKWFyKu38GuTo8GcTnQbbg.text: This is my second time. Brought my sister for her 1st time. Excellent!  I had the French dip burger and hand cut chips. She had the Porch burger and fries. Everything was delicious, served hot and fast. Service by Logan was impeccable. No such thing as an empty drink. Great atmosphere too.

A_TLfvXTbJTQOrO0kO8jQg.text: I've seen a consistent rise in Service and Food from the beginning. I love the atmosphere and the staff is great. Bartenders rock especially Jessica.

NnjEqVyyKvdD6FnJtXg9Ug.text: Tyler-  The staff is asking customers if they will post positive Yelp reviews, and in return will give you a free round of shots.    Good luck!

xbxX9xjoiSFiql6fSw0xzw.text: Updated Review!!  Went again for a quick lunch with a girlfriend. The weather was excessively hot so we didn't get to take advantage of the outdoor area! We were happy that it was just as delicious as our last visit! My salmon salad was delicious- with fresh ingredients and a pleasing presentation. My friend had a wrap sandwich that looked huge with yummy fries! I snuck a few!! Thanks for the great dining experience again!!   OMG!! What can I say...Fabulous!!!! Have been driving by curious about the Porch! Well, my gal pal was celebrating a Birthday and requested we try that establishment...Super! We arrived at about 3:30 Thank Goodness cause it's a hopping little spot with a small parking area. Our server Jamie was so welcoming and eager to discuss the menu & restaurant!! We sat outside on an Amazing day and throughly enjoyed ourselves. Great Happy Hour menu for Beer & Nibbles!! We had the poppers and pretzel with fondue!! Both were delicious! We later decided to split the burger that was a happy hour special as well- so yummy!!! It felt like hanging out at a Pals Porch...I loved it and will bring my hi

q2_JIPe2ONO1Ii-qVv7ONw.text: My boyfriend and I like to come here with our friends to hangout and for good food!  The service here is great, everyone is super friendly and fun! It's a really great environment no doubt!  The service is also really quick, we didn't wait long at all for our food/apps - and it was pretty busy.   The wings are soooooo freaking good, my favorite are the honey chipotle wings, and no they weren't too spicy! My friend that isn't too much of a fan of spicy really liked them too. The wings paired well with their cocktail "my ex wife's secret" which I had to have two of!  Just be sure to end the night with their sea salt chocolate chip cookie and thank me later.

photos.caption: Photo of The Porch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My ex wife&#39;s secret cocktail

90qvy92JhjEIF8QV7tP_bQ.text: Came here for a friends birthday tonight, spent 48 minutes trying to flag down LITERALLY ANYONE on the patio for water, beer or a hello... not even a glance out way.  This place sucks. We told the poor clueless hostess up front about it while her manager and two other servers were slack jawed with eyes glued to the fight on TV.  This place sucks. Plenty of other bars in the area to go to.

0nDCL0K-Qn-fPFSuZARWJA.text: I love this place!   My friend and I were trying to figure out a good place where I could bring my dog and she could bring her kids. After searching around we stumbled upon The Porch. The location is great- walking distance from the Vig and Cold Beers and Cheeseburgers if you're familiar with the area.   The menu has a few good options but I opted for the mason chopped + tossed salad and added grilled chicken . When the waitress brought my food, I noticed there wasn't any chicken but she quickly fixed it. To drink I ordered a new drink on the menu called "tickle me pink". It was good- not too sweet at all because of the champagne in it.   The best part about this is the outdoor area. There are games including corn hole, Jenna (life size), connect 4 (life size), and that hook and ring toss game. It also has tv's. My friend's 6 year old son watched tv while he ate and when he finished eating he entertained himself while his mom and I were talking. It's great because I know it's hard taking your kids out when you're trying to have adult time but this environment made it super easy! I also brought my dog and he was loving the outdoor area. The sweet waitress brought him water too :)

Photo of The Porch - Phoenix, AZ, United States

zdwAyKe1lNuZXZSaLS-lEg.text: Service is really great.  They changed the menu. No more Tennessee hot chicken. No more apple pie dip. The chopped salad is pre tossed so it's not in separate ingredients SO they add wayyyyyyy more argugala. Not a fan. The change is not great. All of our favorites disappeared. Drinks still good. We probably won't be coming as often anymore because our alternative choices weren't hits. French dip burger was good. Jalapeno poppers: were over stuffed jalapeno that doesn't hold and is flimsy. No textural difference. Overly spicy. So so sad our neighborhood go to place has changed. Please bring back the good stuff!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Porch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Apple pie dip. Bombtastic

KWPv6oYeePw2MBLorSESrQ.text: This place is amazing! The food was so over the top good! You have to try the roasted carrots they're the BOMB!!  We are here from San Diego with 2 soccer teams! We had 40 in our party and they were happy to have us!! Our servers (Christian and Lily) were on top of their game. We did not have to wait for anything! Great place for kids with different games to play and alcohol for the parents!! Love the decor and the atmosphere! #parkitatporch

5NaL5EPhoE7os71hNsMOqg.text: First of all I like the feel of the Arcadia district. Twyla and I had salads (burning off the wedding) and some well needed cocktails.   Twinkie has a Kale salad that had a great presentation and I had this huge double wedge salad. I say double wedge as literally two wedges are presented on the plate. It was fantastic and contained grape tomatoes, sauteed onions, chunky blue cheese and thick cut bacon.  This place looks like a good place to catch a game with an ample amount of TV's and drink option set to please both him and her.  The established is very clean and modern. It has very limited parking, so valet was the only option we had. No biggie, a few bucks for a nice guy! I spend that on Starbucks everyday.  The menu was a mixed compilation of American dishes. I will say that the presentations were done well and the quality of the ingredients very fresh. There is a good size patio out front for those nicer evenings and Arizona's cooler months. We dig this area and will be back soon!  #irishcatv2 #twylytephotography #rebelfoodandwine

From the red swinging chairs outside along with high tops, to the yellow booths inside with a big bar in the center, this place is packed on a Friday afternoon.   Ambiance: 4 Drinks: 4 Service: 4

_8Yx7VtLlOszd9saUzvGsQ.text: This place is pretty awesome!! Good vibes and great food... The atmosphere is so chill (even, and especially, with music playing overhead).    Our first time here. Can vouch for the roasted buffalo cauliflower, grilled cheese (+ bacon), and the couscous + veggie bowl (add blackened shrimp)... you won't be disappointed.    The Porch might easily be a 5 star spot, gotta come back and score patio seating to make that call. We lucked up and got seats at the bar and avoided the wait on late Saturday afternoon.  Not sure if every day is this busy, but, definitely recommend joining the waitlist before you venture to the restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of The Porch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Couscous + Veggies (add blackened shrimp). It&#39;s soooo good... Sorry, mixed it up and started eating before I started my review.

mM4kxwXMf89vAv2QkPMIZg.text: The Porch is so much fun! We love coming here on a weekend day. Perfect place for a date, friend or family gathering. I am always impressed with the cocktails and service here. My favorite thing to order is a Tito's with grapefruit and Topo Chico - order it! This place is also dog friendly and kid friendly, too. Two waiters were so nice to my little nephew who is hard to keep still -- they kept him entertained with bean bags from the corn hole game. Food is really delicious, too... we like the brunch options and the mimosas on Sundays.

qVN1CAGt_cgcwj7Is1w49A.text: UPDATE 6/17/19: We visited again on Monday and stayed for 3 hrs! My husband got the French dip burger which I liked more than him because I like the horseradish kick, and I shares the chicken panini with my kiddo. I liked all of the ingredients, but took off the arugula for her and she ate her half of the sandwich. The fries are good. I love the craft cider on draught and my hubs likes the selection of IPA. No salt complaints this time.  We stayed so long so I could kick the hubs butt on the basketball shootout game ( he beat me) though I won my fair share of Pong. Thank you for the offer, Lauren! We didnt want to bug you.

pdK3l-sMcJ8wmz8zA08JbQ.text: Great food. Terrible service.   We had a party of 16 people. The waiter assumed we would all pay together didn't bother to ask or even apologize for not asking. When we got there the main party was already there. We waited roughly 10 minutes before we thought " Oh we must have to order drinks at the bar".... nope. She gave us so much attitude. Cherry on top everyone had their food she had to ask what are you waiting on?

JFoueFEtcplGyPap9dImJA.text: Conceptually, The Porch is a fun, hip, gastropub and for us it delivered on all of those things except for the "gastro" part. The ambiance is young and energetic with lots of activity and mingling. Our bartender was Ty and he was super friendly. The service was really good until they got swamped which is understandable. The food for us was not great, but not bad either. I will say my Porch Burger was seasoned properly and the bacon was good too. The potato chips with it were really disappointing. They were not fresh made which is OK, but they had no salt or other flavor either. We had the wings for an app and they were unremarkable. My wife had the chicken strips and they were cooked OK but under seasoned. As far as cocktails, the Cabin Fever was unbalanced & sickly sweet. Ty replaced it pronto and didn't bat an eye. The craft beer list is healthy and that was what most of the patrons were drinking so I joined them with a delicious Sculpin IPA. It took us 10 minutes to exit the parking lot as it is just too small for this busy restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of The Porch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Can get in either.
Photo of The Porch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Can get out of the parking lot. Total gridlock.
Photo of The Porch - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Porch Burger with Bacon. Sauce is a bit sweet for me.

qqduhyoYlDkOnNa81J85hA.text: Loooove this place. Tonight was super crowded because the UFC fight was on. We came in behind a large crowd and was initially told 35 minutes but the wait turned out to be about 15 mins instead. They have limited options for ppl who only eat seafood, so I always stick to the blackened shrimp tacos! You get 3 for $10 and they're loaded with meat. My husband tried something new and ordered the grilled cheese with turkey and the sweet potato fries on the side. He went on and on about how good it was and ate all of it so I imagine it must have been.

ESbWHzx4IN3pZUYlzy_yyA.text: Relaxing  My friends and I went to "The Porch"  for lunch on a Saturday afternoon. The restraunt  is clean and has a nice relaxing vibe. The chairs are very comfortable and the TVs are mounted at a nice height so your neck doesn't get cramped. In addition, to TV's there is also darts, a giant scrabble board, and a pucks table for your enjoyment.  Happy hour is 5-6:15 pm and features half off appetizers and discounted drinks. However,  I was a bit disappointed with the limited draft selection.  On this visit we shared the Reuben sandwich, chicken panini, Parmesan truffle fries, bruschetta, and pretzels. The food wad good as was the service.  If you're looking for a place to hang out with your friends you should stop by and give "The Porch" a try.

9TUGSsegz-1aUinnNNAoQA.text: Super cool chill spot. We went on a Wednesday and it was perfect. Just enough people but not enough to affect the game situation. Our server was delightful and attentive the entire time. We ordered a rib sandwich and the hot country chicken with jalapeno grits. Everything was good nice flavor. The parmesan fries were nice and crispy. We ordered a couple of cocktails that had jus the right pour. After enjoyed our meals it was time to play some of the outdoor lawn games. You can play cornhole and a giant connect four set up. Inside they have hoops and a few other games. It was the perfect set up to keep people engaged. I really enjoyed the outside area it helped influence our stay for sure along with the drinks.  Enjoy it while the weather holds up.

photos.caption: Photo of The Porch - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Porch - Phoenix, AZ, United States

-XUOzpI4jopQsIXSH7GZWA.text: Went here for my birthday. I am not sure if it's because it was crowded we waited for a long time to have someone come and serve. The food and drinks there were okay, we are not impressed. My friends ordered their drinks before happy hours ended but it was changed with full price when we first got our check. We were able to take the extra change off the bill but we literately went back and forth at least 3 times with the staff before the correct check came back to us.

6G5c_dGo6lxJrASaOoJnKQ.text: Great place for brunch and friendly service! We reserved a table for 13 and they gave us two servers which was awesome! The mulemosa is a must! They have champagne bottles for only $12 during brunch! Great open space inside and out and well lit. They have valet parking as well.   We had the chicken "waffles" and OMG! They are chicken wings and the batter is waffle batter. They then serve a side of syrup that is a bit spicy. Perfect combination of sweet and salty.   We also had the green chili chilaquiles. I prefer mine a bit more crunch this to me was more of a casserole however don't take away the fact that flavor was all there and also a great dish!   We will be back for sure!

0pFmKp3PeYKafhawfZpaCQ.text: Brought a group of almost 20 to have a birthday brunch on the patio. This business is so accommodating! They let us split up checks however we wanted, didn't send us on our way quickly, and the waitress was so helpful. I think her name was Katie. Delicious food and we loved all the lawn games! Definitely will be coming back again!

qsVqPe21jkecrSfeih9XLg.text: This place was awesome. Plenth of out door games, inside games like darts, ski ball, basketball and shuffle board. The food was AMAZING. I had their french dip burger. It was so good, id recoment requesting more oniona if u like onions.
